Remote Two/3 WebSocket Integration API0.13.0-beta
  • Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-SA 4.0)
  • application/json
  • External Docs
  • API Support
  • support@unfoldedcircle.com
  • ID: urn:com:unfoldedcircle:integration

API definition of the Unfolded Circle WebSocket Integration-API for Remote Two/3 (UCR Integration-API in short).

API message status legend:

Icon Description
Idea, not yet official part of API definition.
Planned feature and most likely not (fully) implemented in the initial release.
API definition is work in progress, not ready yet for implementation.
Api definition review & implementation.
API has been implemented in the UC Remote and is currently being tested.
Ready to use - feedback welcomed.

Simple integrations with static entities don't need to implement all messages.
All required messages are tagged with the emoji.

Overview

The UCR Integration-API allows writing device integration drivers for the Unfolded Circle Remotes.

Starting with the UCR2 firmware beta release 1.9.0, custom integration drivers can be installed on the UC Remote.

The integration driver acts as server and the UC Remote as client. The remote connects to the integration when an integration instance is configured. Whenever the remote enters standby it may choose to disconnect and connect again after wakeup.

The goal of the Integration-API is to cover simple static drivers like controlling GPIOs on a Raspberry Pi, up to integrating existing home automation hubs like Home Assistant, Homey, ioBroker, openHAB etc.
The focus of the integration API is on entity integration, not on controlling or configuring the UC Remote. Please refer to the Core-API for other functionality: https://github.com/unfoldedcircle/core-api

API Versioning

The API is versioned according to SemVer.
The initial public release will be 1.0.0 once it is considered stable enough with some initial integration implementations and developer examples.

Any major version zero (0.y.z) is for initial development and may change at any time!
I.e. backward compatibility for minor releases is not yet established, anything MAY change at any time!

  • #registration
  • #device
  • #setup
  • #entity
  • #event
  • #metadata
  • #required
  • #oauth2

Servers

  • localhost:8001wstest

    Local test server.

    Security:
    • HTTP API key
      • Name: auth-token
      • In: header

      The API token is either provided in the auth-token header while upgrading to a WebSocket connection, or with an authentication message.

      • If the integration driver doesn't support header based authentication, it must send the auth_required message event after the WebSocket connection is established. The UC Remote will then authenticate with the auth request message.
      • If the driver doesn't support or require authentication, it still needs to send the authentication message with code: 200 and req_id: 0 after the WebSocket connection has been established by the UC Remote.
  • localhost:8443wsstest-wss

    Local test server.

    Security:
    • HTTP API key
      • Name: auth-token
      • In: header

      The API token is either provided in the auth-token header while upgrading to a WebSocket connection, or with an authentication message.

      • If the integration driver doesn't support header based authentication, it must send the auth_required message event after the WebSocket connection is established. The UC Remote will then authenticate with the auth request message.
      • If the driver doesn't support or require authentication, it still needs to send the authentication message with code: 200 and req_id: 0 after the WebSocket connection has been established by the UC Remote.

Operations

  • PUB /intg

    Integration API for the UC Remote to interact with custom devices.
    The publish channel lists all messages that the UC Remote sends to an integration driver server.

    Operation IDpubIntegrationMessage

    Accepts one of the following messages:

    • #0auth

      Authenticate a connection.

      Sent by the UC Remote after an auth_required request by the integration driver.

      object allOf
      uid: authRequestMsg
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"auth"
      required
      object
      token
      string

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      Authentication response.
      description
      The authentication result is provided in the `code` attribute: - `200`: success, API can be used and message requests are accepted. - `401`: authentication failed, the provided token is not valid. The UC Remote will close the connection. The driver should also close the connection after sending this response. If the driver doesn't support or require authentication, it still needs to send the `authentication` message with `code: 200` and `req_id: 0` after the WebSocket connection has been established by the UC Remote. It's recommended to send the optional driver version object in the the msg_data payload to avoid eventual additional message exchanges.
      object allOf
      uid: authMsg
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"authentication"
      object
      uid: driverVersion
      name
      string
      object
      api
      string
      driver
      string

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      name
      required
      schemaFormat
      application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 0,
  "msg": "auth",
  "msg_data": {
    "token": "string"
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.

      Get version information about the integration driver.

      object allOf
      uid: getDriverVersionMsg
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0

      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"get_driver_version"

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      Integration driver version information response.
      object allOf
      uid: driverVersionMsg
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

    • #2get_driver_metadata

      Retrieve the integration driver metadata.

      The metadata is used to setup the driver in the remote / web-configurator and start the setup flow.

      object allOf
      uid: getDriverMetadataMsg
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"get_driver_metadata"

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      Integration driver metadata response.
      name
      metadata
      name
      required
      object allOf
      uid: driverMetadataMsg
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"driver_metadata"
      required
      object
      uid: driverMetadata

      Integration driver metadata.

      driver_id
      required
      string
      required
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      driver_url
      string
      format: uri<= 2048 characters

      Optional WebSocket URL of the driver to override mDNS information.

      auth_method
      string
      uid: intgAuthMethod

      Integration driver authentication method if a token is required.

      The JSON auth message is used if a token is configured but no authentication method is set.

        Allowed values:
      • "HEADER"
      • "MESSAGE"
      version
      required
      string
      <= 20 characters

      Driver version, SemVer preferred.

      min_core_api
      string
      <= 20 characters

      Optional version check: minimum required Core-API version in the remote.

      icon
      string
      <= 255 charactersuid: iconIdentifier

      Optional icon identifier. If specified the icon will be set. An empty identifier while updating the object removes the existing icon.

      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      object
      uid: driverDeveloper

      Optional information about the integration developer.

      name
      string
      <= 50 characters

      Optional developer information to display in UI / web-configurator.

      url
      string
      format: uri<= 255 characters

      Optional developer home page.

      email
      string
      format: email<= 100 characters

      Optional developer contact email.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      home_page
      string
      format: uri<= 255 characters

      Optional home page url for more information.

      device_discovery
      boolean

      Driver supports multi-device discovery. Not yet supported.

      object
      uid: DriverManifest

      The driver manifest contains required and optional features for the driver to work.

      Furthermore, it can also contain additional metadata for the Core service, which is required for certain features. For example OAuth2 configuration data like the authorization and token endpoints. This data may only be transmitted to the core, but won't be exposed in the driver management API endpoints.

      array<object>

      Required features of an integration driver.

      name
      required
      string
      <= 50 characters

      Feature name

      required
      boolean

      Optional or required feature

      Default value:true
      object

      Feature specific data

      Additional properties are allowed.

      iot_class
      string
      uid: IotClass

      How the integration connects and communicates with a device or service. Inspired by Home Assistant IoT class.

        Allowed values:
      • "assumed_state"
      • "cloud_polling"
      • "cloud_push"
      • "local_polling"
      • "local_push"

      Additional properties are allowed.

      object
      uid: SettingsPage

      Settings definition page, e.g. to configure an integration driver.

      required
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      required
      array<object>

      One or multiple input field definitions, with optional pre-set values.

      id
      required
      string
      <= 50

      Unique identifier of the setting to be returned with the entered value.

      required
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      required
      oneOf
      object
      uid: SettingTypeNumber

      Number input with optional min, max, steps and decimals properties. The default value must be specified in value. An optional unit of the number setting can be specified in units, which will be displayed next to the input field.

      required
      object
      value
      required
      number

      Default value for input field.

      min
      number

      Optional validation: minimum allowed value (inclusive).

      max
      number

      Optional validation: maximum allowed value (inclusive).

      steps
      number

      Optional validation: allowed step increment between values. Might also be used in the UI for input helpers.

      decimals
      integer
      >= 0

      Number of decimal places. 0 = integer value

      Default value:0
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      object
      uid: SettingTypeText

      Single line of text input.

      TODO: format specifier for e.g. email, url, date, datetime etc.?

      required
      object
      value
      string

      Optional default value.

      regex
      string

      Optional regex validation pattern for the input value.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      object
      uid: SettingTypeTextArea

      Multi-line text input, e.g. for providing a description.

      required
      object
      value
      string

      Optional default value.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      object
      uid: SettingTypePassword

      Password or pin entry field with the input text hidden from the user. Otherwise the same as text input.

      required
      object
      value
      string
      format: password

      Optional default value.

      regex
      string

      Optional regex validation pattern for the input value.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      object
      uid: SettingTypeCheckbox

      Checkbox setting with true / false values.

      required
      object
      value
      required
      boolean

      Initial setting.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      object
      uid: SettingTypeDropdown

      Dropdown setting to pick a single value from a list. All values must be strings.

      required
      object
      value
      string

      Pre-selected dropdown id

      required
      array<object>
      id
      required
      string

      Selection identifier.

      required
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      object
      uid: SettingTypeLabel

      Additional read-only text for information purpose between other settings. Supports Markdown formatting.

      required
      object
      required
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      release_date
      string
      format: date

      Release date of the driver.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      schemaFormat
      application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
      • #metadata

      {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 0,
  "msg": "get_driver_metadata"

      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #3connect

      Event to establish connection to entities or devices.

      Optional: this event instructs the integration to establish the required connections to interact with the provided entities or devices.

      The integration should send device_state events to inform the UC Remote about the connection state.

      object allOf
      uid: connectEvent

      For simple drivers without dynamic devices the msg_data object can be omitted. In this case, the connect event is for the overall integration driver and not for a specific device.

      object
      uid: commonEvent

      Common event message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Event message identifier.

      Const:"event"
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API event message types.

      cat
      string

      Event category.

      ts
      string
      format: date-time

      Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

      required
      object

      Wrapper for event data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"connect"
      cat
      string
      Const:"DEVICE"
      object
      device_id
      string

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #device
      • #event

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "event",
  "msg": "connect",
  "cat": "DEVICE",
  "ts": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  "msg_data": {
    "device_id": "string"
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #4disconnect

      Event to stop the connection to entities or devices.

      Optional: this event instructs the integration to stop the interactions with the provided entities or devices, because the UC Remote temporarily doesn't need the entities. It's up to the integration what to do, but it needs to be prepared to react on a connect event.

      The integration should send device_state events to inform the UC Remote about the connection state.

      object allOf
      uid: disconnectEvent

      For simple drivers without dynamic devices the msg_data object can be omitted. In this case, the disconnect event is for the overall integration driver and not for a specific device.

      object
      uid: commonEvent

      Common event message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Event message identifier.

      Const:"event"
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API event message types.

      cat
      string

      Event category.

      ts
      string
      format: date-time

      Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

      required
      object

      Wrapper for event data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"disconnect"
      cat
      string
      Const:"DEVICE"
      object
      device_id
      string

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #device
      • #event

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "event",
  "msg": "disconnect",
  "cat": "DEVICE",
  "ts": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  "msg_data": {
    "device_id": "string"
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #5get_device_state

      Get the current integration driver or device state.

      Called by the UC Remote when it needs to synchronize the device state, e.g. after waking up from standby, or if it doesn't receive regular device_state events.

      The device_id property is only required if the driver supports multiple device instances.

      Note: this request will not be answered with a response message but with an event.

      object allOf
      uid: getDeviceStateMsg

      For simple drivers without dynamic devices the msg_data object can be omitted. In this case, the request is for the overall integration driver and not for a specific device.

      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"get_device_state"
      object
      device_id
      string

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      Current integration driver or device state event.
      description
      If there's a device communication issue or other error, this state will inform the user with a UI notification about the issue. This event should be triggered by the integration driver whenever the state changes. Furthermore, the UC Remote can request the current state with the `get_device_state` request.
      name
      device
      name
      required
      object allOf
      uid: deviceStateEventMsg
      object
      uid: commonEvent

      Common event message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Event message identifier.

      Const:"event"
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API event message types.

      cat
      string

      Event category.

      ts
      string
      format: date-time

      Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

      required
      object

      Wrapper for event data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"device_state"
      cat
      string
      Const:"DEVICE"
      required
      object
      uid: deviceState
      device_id
      string
      state
      required
      string
        Allowed values:
      • "CONNECTED"
      • "CONNECTING"
      • "DISCONNECTED"
      • "ERROR"

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      schemaFormat
      application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
      • #device
      • #required

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 0,
  "msg": "get_device_state",
  "msg_data": {
    "device_id": "string"
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #6setup_driver

      Start driver setup.

      If a driver includes a setup_data_schema object in its driver metadata, it enables the dynamic driver setup process. The setup process can be a simple "start-confirm-done" between the UC Remote and the integration driver, or a fully dynamic, multi-step process with user interactions, where the user has to provide additional data or select different options.

      The reconfigure flag indicates if the user wants to reconfigure an already configured driver in the Remote. It's up to the driver on how to handle a reconfiguration request and run a different logic. For example, this allows to show an options screen to change certain values, or present the option to modify, add or delete provided device entities.

      After confirming the setup_driver request, the integration driver has to send driver_setup_change events:

      • event_type: SETUP with state: SETUP is a progress event to keep the process running, see below.
      • event_type: SETUP with state: WAIT_USER_ACTION can be sent to the UC Remote to request a user interaction: either a confirmation to press next to continue the process, or input values.
      • event_type: STOP with event: OK finishes the setup process and the UC Remote creates an integration instance.
      • event_type: STOP with event: ERROR aborts the setup process.

      If the setup process takes more than a few seconds, the integration should send driver_setup_change events with state: SETUP to the UC Remote to show a setup progress to the user and prevent an inactivity timeout.
      Default setup timeouts:

      • Setup progress (watchdog): 60 seconds. If no setup message is received within that time, the setup process is aborted.
      • User action timeout: 3 minutes. If there's no user response within that time, the setup process is aborted.
      • Overall setup timeout: 5 minutes. The setup process is automatically aborted if it is still running after that time.

      If no setup is needed, but the integration driver requires to show additional information to the user before the integration is setup (e.g. terms & conditions, further help information or web links, etc.), it can define an "information settings page" with text labels in setup_data_schema without any input fields. In this case the integration simply has to respond with a driver_setup_change event message with event_type: STOP and state: OK after confirming the setup_driver request message.

      object allOf
      uid: setupDriverMsg
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"setup_driver"
      required
      object
      reconfigure
      boolean

      If set to true: reconfigure an already configured driver.

      required
      object
      uid: SettingsValues

      User input result of a SettingsPage as key values.

      • key: id of the field
      • value: entered user value as string. This is either the entered text or number, selected checkbox state or the selected dropdown item id.
        Non native string values as numbers or booleans are represented as string values!
      Additional properties:
      string

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      Command result message.
      description
      A result message is a response message containing a result code and optional error information without further payload.
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      required

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id

      Default value:0

      Default value:200

    • #7set_driver_user_data

      Provide requested driver setup data.

      Set required data to configure the integration driver or continue the setup process.

      Defined user actions to set in the request body action field:

      • input_values: if the user was requested to enter settings, e.g. connection or credential parameters to a device or service.
      • confirm: response to the user action confirmation. Set to true if the user had to perform an action like pressing a button on a device and then confirms the action with continuing the setup process.
        The false value is not yet used but might be used in the future for yes / no choices.

      The state field in the response message indicate the current state of the setup process.

      object allOf
      uid: setDriverUserDataMsg
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      required

      • key: id of the field
      • value: entered user value as string. This is either the entered text or number, selected checkbox state or the selected dropdown item id.
        Non native string values as numbers or booleans are represented as string values!

    • #8abort_driver_setup

      Abort a driver setup.

      If the user aborts the setup process, the UC Remote sends this event. Further messages from the integration from the setup process will be ignored afterwards.

      object allOf
      uid: abortDriverSetupEvent
      object
      uid: commonEvent

      string
      Const:"DEVICE"
      required

      required
      string
      uid: integrationSetupError

      More detailed error reason for state: ERROR condition.

        Allowed values:
      • "NONE"
      • "NOT_FOUND"
      • "CONNECTION_REFUSED"
      • "AUTHORIZATION_ERROR"
      • "TIMEOUT"
      • "OTHER"

      • #event

  "msg_data": {
    "error": "NONE"
  }

    • #9get_available_entities

      Retrieve the available entities from the integration driver.

      Called while configuring profiles and assigning entities to pages or groups in the web-configurator or the embedded editor of the remote UI.

      With the optional filter, only entities of a given type can be requested.

      object allOf
      uid: getAvailableEntitiesMsg
      • TODO add paging: worst case this could include hundreds if not thousands of entities!
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"get_available_entities"
      object
      object
      uid: availableEntityFilter

      Optional filters

      device_id
      string

      Optional device instance filter if driver supports multi instances.

      string anyOf
      uid: entityType

      Supported entities, defined as extensible enum: already known entity types are in the enum, but other string values are allowed for forward compatability.

      Can adhere to:
      string
        Allowed values:
      • "button"
      • "switch"
      • "light"
      • "cover"
      • "media_player"
      • "climate"
      • "sensor"
      • "remote"
      • "ir_emitter"
      Or to:
      any

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      description

      Const:"available_entities"
      required
      object
      object
      uid: availableEntityFilter

      Optional filters

      device_id
      string

      Optional device instance filter if driver supports multi instances.

      string anyOf
      uid: entityType

      Supported entities, defined as extensible enum: already known entity types are in the enum, but other string values are allowed for forward compatability.

      Can adhere to:
      string
        Allowed values:
      • "button"
      • "switch"
      • "light"
      • "cover"
      • "media_player"
      • "climate"
      • "sensor"
      • "remote"
      • "ir_emitter"
      Or to:
      any

      Additional properties are allowed.

      required
      array<object>
      entity_id
      required
      string

      Unique entity identifier.

      entity_type
      required
      string

      Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

      device_id
      string

      Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

      array<string>

      Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

      Items:
      string
      required
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      area
      string

      Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      schemaFormat
      application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
      • #entity
      • #required

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 0,
  "msg": "get_available_entities",
  "msg_data": {
    "filter": {
      "device_id": "string",
      "entity_type": "button"
    }
  }
}

    • #10subscribe_events

    • #11unsubscribe_events

      Unsubscribe from events.

      If no entity IDs are specified then all events for all available entities are stopped.

      This message is sent by the UC Remote if a previously configured entity is no longer used and therefore no longer interested in entity updates. If the integration driver keeps sending events for the unsubscribed entities then they are simply discarded.

      object allOf
      uid: unsubscribeEventsMsg

    • #12get_entity_states

      Get the current state of the configured entities.

      Called by the UC Remote when it needs to synchronize the dynamic entity attributes, e.g. after connection setup or waking up from standby.

      The integration should only send the state of the configured entities to reduce communication overhead, especially if there are many available entities, from which only a few are getting configured on the remote.
      Any additional data will be ignored.

      Furthermore, the integration driver is free to decide which entity states it wants to send back. It's even advisable to use dirty flags in the integration driver if there are a lot of entities, and only return the changed data.

      Future change announcement: this request will be enhanced with a force flag (or the like) to signal that all entity states are required, and no data should be suppressed. This will happen for example after the remote is restarted.

      object allOf
      uid: getEntityStatesMsg

      For simple drivers without dynamic devices the msg_data.device_id property can be omitted. In this case, the request is for the overall integration driver and not for a specific device.

      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"get_entity_states"
      object
      device_id
      string

      Only required for multi-device integrations.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      Current state of the entities.
      description
      Response message of the `get_entity_states` request. Contains the dynamic attributes of all entities.
      name
      entity
      name
      required
      object allOf
      uid: entityStatesMsg

      The msg_data payload is an array of the entity_change event.

      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind

    • #13entity_command

      Execute an entity command.

      Instruct the integration driver to execute a command like "turn on" or "change temperature". Optional command data like temperature value or channel number can be provided in the params array. The parameter objects are described in the entity feature definitions.

      The result response is to acknowledge the command and to return any immediate failures in case the driver already knows it's unable to perform the command due to invalid data, device communication issues etc.

      After successfully executing a command, the UC Remote expects an entity_change event with the updated feature value(s).

      object allOf
      uid: entityCommandMsg
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"entity_command"
      required
      object
      device_id
      string
      entity_id
      required
      string
      cmd_id
      required
      string
      object

      See https://github.com/unfoldedcircle/core-api/tree/main/doc/entities for command parameter definitions.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      Command result message.
      description
      A result message is a response message containing a result code and optional error information without further payload.
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0

      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    "entity_type": "switch",
    "entity_id": "switch-1",
    "cmd_id": "on"
  }
}

        {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 124,
  "msg": "entity_command",
  "msg_data": {
    "entity_type": "switch",
    "entity_id": "switch-1",
    "cmd_id": "off"
  }
}
      • #4 Example
        {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 125,
  "msg": "entity_command",
  "msg_data": {
    "entity_type": "light",
    "entity_id": "light-1",
    "cmd_id": "on"
  }
}
      • #5 Example
        {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 125,
  "msg": "entity_command",
  "msg_data": {
    "entity_type": "light",
    "entity_id": "light-1",
    "cmd_id": "on",
    "params": {
      "brightness": 50,
      "temperature": 70
    }
  }
}
      • #6 Example
        {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 126,
  "msg": "entity_command",
  "msg_data": {
    "entity_type": "cover",
    "entity_id": "blind-1",
    "cmd_id": "up"
  }
}
      • #7 Example
        {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 126,
  "msg": "entity_command",
  "msg_data": {
    "entity_type": "cover",
    "entity_id": "blind-1",
    "cmd_id": "position",
    "params": {
      "position": 50
    }
  }
}

    "entity_type": "cover",
    "entity_id": "blind-2_cover-only",
    "cmd_id": "open"
  }

    • #14enter_standby

      UC Remote goes into standby event.

      Notification event that the UC Remote goes into standby mode and won't process incoming events anymore.

      object allOf
      uid: enterStandbyEvent

      TODO add standby type in msg_data? E.g. "screen off" & "sleep" for the integration to be notified that the UC Remote is no longer reachable? While the screen is off, the remote API is still running, but might soon go into sleep state.

      object
      uid: commonEvent

      Common event message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Event message identifier.

      Const:"event"
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API event message types.

      cat
      string

      Event category.

      ts
      string
      format: date-time

      Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

      required
      object

      Wrapper for event data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"enter_standby"
      cat
      string
      Const:"REMOTE"

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #device
      • #entity
      • #event

      Examples

  "kind": "event",

  "cat": "REMOTE",
  "ts": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  "msg_data": {}
}

    • #15exit_standby

      UC Remote leaves standby event.

      Notification event that the UC Remote is out of standby. The integration should resume operation if it suspended it while receiving the enter_standby event.
      This allows the integration to submit any entity state changes. Otherwise the UC Remote will likely request an entity state update.

      object allOf
      uid: exitStandbyEvent
      object
      uid: commonEvent

      Common event message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Event message identifier.

      Const:"event"
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      string

      ts
      string
      format: date-time

      Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

      required
      object

      Wrapper for event data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"exit_standby"
      cat
      string
      Const:"REMOTE"

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #device
      • #entity
      • #event

  "kind": "event",
  "msg": "exit_standby",

  "ts": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",

    • #16version

      Remote version information response.

      object allOf
      uid: versionMsg
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"version"
      required
      object
      uid: versionInfo
      model
      string

      Short model identifier of the remote (UCR2 for Remote Two, UCR3 for Remote 3).

      device_name
      string

      Custom name of the remote

      hostname
      string

      Hostname of the remote

      address
      string

      MAC address of the remote

      api
      string

      API version

      core
      string

      Core app version

      ui
      string

      Frontend app version

      os
      string

      Operating system version

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "resp",
  "req_id": 0,
  "msg": "version",
  "code": 200,
  "msg_data": {
    "model": "string",
    "device_name": "string",
    "hostname": "string",
    "address": "string",
    "api": "string",
    "core": "string",
    "ui": "string",
    "os": "string"
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.

    • #19localization_cfg

      Active localization settings of the UC Remote.

      allOf
      uid: localizationMsg
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"localization_cfg"
      required
      object
      uid: localizationSettings
      language_code
      string
      must match: ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$uid: languageCode

      Language culture code: starting with the two-letter ISO-639-1 code, followed by an optional ISO-3166 country code, separated by an underscore. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_DE, de_CH etc.

      country_code
      string
      format: iso-3166uid: countryCode

      Two-letter country codes defined in ISO-3166-1-alpha-2

      time_zone
      string

      Time zone name according to IANA https://www.iana.org/time-zones, e.g. Europe/Copenhagen.

      time_format_24h
      boolean
      Default value:true
      measurement_unit
      string
      uid: measurementUnit
        Allowed values:
      • "METRIC"
      • "US"
      • "UK"

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #metadata

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "resp",
  "req_id": 0,
  "msg": "localization_cfg",
  "code": 200,
  "msg_data": {
    "language_code": "string",
    "country_code": "string",
    "time_zone": "string",
    "time_format_24h": true,
    "measurement_unit": "METRIC"
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #20runtime_info

      Driver runtime information from the UC Remote.

      allOf
      uid: runtimeInfoMsg
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required

      >= 0uid: msgId

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"runtime_info"
      required
      object
      uid: runtimeInfo
      driver_id
      required
      string

      Identifier under which this integration driver is accessible in the Remote.

      array<string>

      Defined integration instance identifiers of this integration driver in the Remote.
      Only single-device integration drivers are supported at the moment, i.e. there's maximum one integration instance per driver.

      Items:
      string
      log_id
      string

      Log service identifier for a custom integration driver running on the Remote.

      Additional properties are allowed.

    • #22oauth2_token

      OAuth2 access token.

      object allOf
      uid: oauth2TokenMsg
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"oauth2_token"
      required
      object
      token_id
      required
      string
      required
      object
      uid: Oauth2Token

      OAuth token response, based on https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-5.1

      access_token
      required
      string

      The access token issued by the authorization server.

      token_type
      required
      string

      The type of the token issued. E.g. Bearer.

      expires_in
      integer

      The time period (in seconds) for which the access_token is valid.

      refresh_token
      string

      The refresh token, which can be used to obtain new access tokens using the same authorization grant.

      scope
      string

      A space-separated list of scopes which have been granted for this access_token.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #oauth2

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "resp",
  "req_id": 0,
  "msg": "oauth2_token",
  "code": 200,
  "msg_data": {
    "token_id": "string",
    "token": {
      "access_token": "string",
      "token_type": "string",
      "expires_in": 0,
      "refresh_token": "string",
      "scope": "string"
    }
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #23oauth2_authorization

      Event that user has authorized the service.

      This event is sent after the user has authorized the service. If the authorization was successful, the Core retrieves the initial token for the integration to retrieve further information and setup the integration driver.

      If authorization or token retrieval failed, the error field is set.

      The returned token is not saved in the Core. An integration driver has to use create_oauth2_cfg to persist an OAuth2 authorization for future use.

      implemented in firmware 2.2.3.

      object allOf
      uid: oauth2AuthorizedEvent
      object
      uid: commonEvent

      Common event message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Event message identifier.

      Const:"event"
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API event message types.

      cat
      string

      Event category.

      ts
      string
      format: date-time

      Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

      required
      object

      Wrapper for event data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"oauth2_authorization"
      cat
      string
      Const:"REMOTE"
      required
      object
      required
      object

      Provided key-value pairs in the authorization request URL.

      Additional properties:
      string
      error_code
      string
      error_description
      string
      object
      uid: Oauth2Token

      OAuth token response, based on https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-5.1

      access_token
      required
      string

      The access token issued by the authorization server.

      token_type
      required
      string

      The type of the token issued. E.g. Bearer.

      expires_in
      integer

      The time period (in seconds) for which the access_token is valid.

      refresh_token
      string

      The refresh token, which can be used to obtain new access tokens using the same authorization grant.

      scope
      string

      A space-separated list of scopes which have been granted for this access_token.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #oauth2

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "event",
  "msg": "oauth2_authorization",
  "cat": "REMOTE",
  "ts": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  "msg_data": {
    "client_data": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    },
    "error_code": "string",
    "error_description": "string",
    "token": {
      "access_token": "string",
      "token_type": "string",
      "expires_in": 0,
      "refresh_token": "string",
      "scope": "string"
    }
  }
}

  • SUB /intg

    Integration API for the UC Remote to receive messages from integration drivers.
    The subscribe channel lists all messages that the integration driver server sends to the UC Remote.

    Operation IDsubIntegrationMessage

    Accepts one of the following messages:

    • #0auth_required

      Authentication request event after connection is established.

      This event is only sent if the integration doesn't support header based authentication during connection setup.
      The UC Remote will then authenticate with the auth request message.

      object allOf
      uid: authRequiredEvent
      object
      uid: commonEvent

      Common event message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Event message identifier.

      Const:"event"
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API event message types.

      cat
      string

      Event category.

      ts
      string
      format: date-time

      Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

      required
      object

      Wrapper for event data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"auth_required"
      object
      uid: driverVersion
      name
      string
      object
      api
      string
      driver
      string

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #event

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "event",
  "msg": "auth_required",
  "cat": "string",
  "ts": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  "msg_data": {
    "name": "string",
    "version": {
      "api": "string",
      "driver": "string"
    }
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #1authentication

      Authentication response.

      The authentication result is provided in the code attribute:

      • 200: success, API can be used and message requests are accepted.
      • 401: authentication failed, the provided token is not valid.
        The UC Remote will close the connection. The driver should also close the connection after sending this response.

      If the driver doesn't support or require authentication, it still needs to send the authentication message with code: 200 and req_id: 0 after the WebSocket connection has been established by the UC Remote.

      It's recommended to send the optional driver version object in the the msg_data payload to avoid eventual additional message exchanges.

      object allOf
      uid: authMsg
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"authentication"
      object
      uid: driverVersion
      name
      string
      object
      api
      string
      driver
      string

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #required

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "resp",
  "req_id": 0,
  "msg": "authentication",
  "code": 200,
  "msg_data": {
    "name": "string",
    "version": {
      "api": "string",
      "driver": "string"
    }
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #2result

      Command result message.

      A result message is a response message containing a result code and optional error information without further payload.

      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #required

      Examples

      • #1 Example
        {
  "kind": "resp",
  "req_id": 123,
  "msg": "result",
  "code": 200
}
      • #2 Example
        {
  "kind": "resp",
  "req_id": 124,
  "msg": "result",
  "code": 400,
  "msg_data": {
    "code": "INV_ARGUMENT",
    "message": "Invalid argument. Foo must be a positive number."
  }
}

    • #4driver_metadata

      Integration driver metadata response.

      object allOf
      uid: driverMetadataMsg
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"driver_metadata"
      required
      object
      uid: driverMetadata

      Integration driver metadata.

      driver_id
      required
      string
      required
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      driver_url
      string
      format: uri<= 2048 characters

      Optional WebSocket URL of the driver to override mDNS information.

      auth_method
      string
      uid: intgAuthMethod

      Integration driver authentication method if a token is required.

      The JSON auth message is used if a token is configured but no authentication method is set.

        Allowed values:
      • "HEADER"
      • "MESSAGE"
      version
      required
      string
      <= 20 characters

      Driver version, SemVer preferred.

      min_core_api
      string
      <= 20 characters

      Optional version check: minimum required Core-API version in the remote.

      icon
      string
      <= 255 charactersuid: iconIdentifier

      Optional icon identifier. If specified the icon will be set. An empty identifier while updating the object removes the existing icon.

      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      object
      uid: driverDeveloper

      Optional information about the integration developer.

      name
      string
      <= 50 characters

      Optional developer information to display in UI / web-configurator.

      url
      string
      format: uri<= 255 characters

      Optional developer home page.

      email
      string
      format: email<= 100 characters

      Optional developer contact email.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      home_page
      string
      format: uri<= 255 characters

      Optional home page url for more information.

      device_discovery
      boolean

      Driver supports multi-device discovery. Not yet supported.

      object
      uid: DriverManifest

      The driver manifest contains required and optional features for the driver to work.

      Furthermore, it can also contain additional metadata for the Core service, which is required for certain features. For example OAuth2 configuration data like the authorization and token endpoints. This data may only be transmitted to the core, but won't be exposed in the driver management API endpoints.

      array<object>

      Required features of an integration driver.

      name
      required
      string
      <= 50 characters

      Feature name

      required
      boolean

      Optional or required feature

      Default value:true
      object

      Feature specific data

      Additional properties are allowed.

      iot_class
      string
      uid: IotClass

      How the integration connects and communicates with a device or service. Inspired by Home Assistant IoT class.

        Allowed values:
      • "assumed_state"
      • "cloud_polling"
      • "cloud_push"
      • "local_polling"
      • "local_push"

      Additional properties are allowed.

      object
      uid: SettingsPage

      Settings definition page, e.g. to configure an integration driver.

      required
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      required
      array<object>

      One or multiple input field definitions, with optional pre-set values.

      id
      required
      string
      <= 50

      Unique identifier of the setting to be returned with the entered value.

      required
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      required
      oneOf
      object
      uid: SettingTypeNumber

      Number input with optional min, max, steps and decimals properties. The default value must be specified in value. An optional unit of the number setting can be specified in units, which will be displayed next to the input field.

      required
      object
      value
      required
      number

      Default value for input field.

      min
      number

      Optional validation: minimum allowed value (inclusive).

      max
      number

      Optional validation: maximum allowed value (inclusive).

      steps
      number

      Optional validation: allowed step increment between values. Might also be used in the UI for input helpers.

      decimals
      integer
      >= 0

      Number of decimal places. 0 = integer value

      Default value:0
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)

      • #metadata
      • #required

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "resp",
  "req_id": 0,
  "msg": "driver_metadata",
  "code": 200,
  "msg_data": {
    "driver_id": "string",
    "name": {},
    "driver_url": "http://example.com",
    "auth_method": "HEADER",
    "version": "string",
    "min_core_api": "string",
    "icon": "string",
    "description": {},
    "developer": {
      "name": "string",
      "url": "http://example.com",
      "email": "user@example.com"
    },
    "home_page": "http://example.com",
    "device_discovery": true,
    "manifest": {
      "features": [
        {
          "name": "string",
          "required": true,
          "data": {}
        }
      ],
      "iot_class": "assumed_state"
    },
    "setup_data_schema": {
      "title": {},
      "settings": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "label": {},
          "field": {
            "number": {
              "value": 0,
              "min": 0,
              "max": 0,
              "steps": 0,
              "decimals": 0,
              "unit": {}
            }
          }
        }
      ]
    },
    "release_date": "2019-08-24"
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #5device_state

      Current integration driver or device state event.

      If there's a device communication issue or other error, this state will inform the user with a UI notification about the issue.

      This event should be triggered by the integration driver whenever the state changes. Furthermore, the UC Remote can request the current state with the get_device_state request.

      object allOf
      uid: deviceStateEventMsg
      object
      uid: commonEvent

      Common event message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Event message identifier.

      Const:"event"
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API event message types.

      cat
      string

      Event category.

      ts
      string
      format: date-time

      Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

      required
      object

      Wrapper for event data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"device_state"
      cat
      string
      Const:"DEVICE"
      required
      object
      uid: deviceState
      device_id
      string
      state
      required
      string
        Allowed values:
      • "CONNECTED"
      • "CONNECTING"
      • "DISCONNECTED"
      • "ERROR"

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #device
      • #required

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "event",
  "msg": "device_state",
  "cat": "DEVICE",
  "ts": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  "msg_data": {
    "device_id": "string",
    "state": "CONNECTED"
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #6driver_setup_change

      Driver setup state change event.

      Emitted for all driver setup flow state changes.

      Different change events:

      • SETUP: send progress, setup is still running
      • WAIT_USER_ACTION: integration driver requires user input
      • OK: integration setup successfully completed
      • ERROR: integration setup failed
      object allOf
      uid: driverSetupChangeEvent
      object
      uid: commonEvent

      Common event message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Event message identifier.

      Const:"event"
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API event message types.

      cat
      string

      Event category.

      ts
      string
      format: date-time

      Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

      required
      object

      Wrapper for event data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"driver_setup_change"
      cat
      string
      Const:"DEVICE"
      required
      object
      uid: driverSetupChange
      event_type
      required
      string
      • START: setup started
      • SETUP: setup in progress. See state enum for current setup state.
      • STOP: setup finished, either with: state: OK for successful setup, or state: ERROR if setup didn't completed successfully.
        Allowed values:
      • "START"
      • "SETUP"
      • "STOP"
      state
      required
      string
      uid: integrationSetupState
      • SETUP: setup in progress
      • WAIT_USER_ACTION: setup flow is waiting for user input. See require_user_action for requested input.
      • OK: setup finished successfully
      • ERROR: setup error
        Allowed values:
      • "SETUP"
      • "WAIT_USER_ACTION"
      • "OK"
      • "ERROR"
      error
      string
      uid: integrationSetupError

      More detailed error reason for state: ERROR condition.

        Allowed values:
      • "NONE"
      • "NOT_FOUND"
      • "CONNECTION_REFUSED"
      • "AUTHORIZATION_ERROR"
      • "TIMEOUT"
      • "OTHER"
      object oneOf

      If set, the setup process waits for the specified user action.

      object
      required
      object
      uid: SettingsPage

      Settings definition page, e.g. to configure an integration driver.

      required
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      required
      array<object>

      One or multiple input field definitions, with optional pre-set values.

      id
      required
      string
      <= 50

      Unique identifier of the setting to be returned with the entered value.

      required
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)

    • #7entity_states

      Current state of the entities.

      Response message of the get_entity_states request. Contains the dynamic attributes of all entities.

      object allOf
      uid: entityStatesMsg

      The msg_data payload is an array of the entity_change event.

      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"entity_states"
      required
      array<object>
      device_id
      string
      entity_type
      required
      string
      entity_id
      required
      string
      required
      object

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #entity
      • #required

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "resp",
  "req_id": 0,
  "msg": "entity_states",
  "code": 200,
  "msg_data": [
    {
      "device_id": "string",
      "entity_type": "string",
      "entity_id": "string",
      "attributes": {}
    }
  ]
}
