    • #8available_entities

      Available entities response.

      This message contains the available entities from the integration driver the UC Remote can configure.

      If the get_available_entities request included a filter, it is returned in the message data with only the matching entities.

      object allOf
      uid: availableEntitiesMsg
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"available_entities"
      required
      object
      object
      uid: availableEntityFilter

      Optional filters

      device_id
      string

      Optional device instance filter if driver supports multi instances.

      string anyOf
      uid: entityType

      Supported entities, defined as extensible enum: already known entity types are in the enum, but other string values are allowed for forward compatability.

      Can adhere to:
      string
        Allowed values:
      • "button"
      • "switch"
      • "light"
      • "cover"
      • "media_player"
      • "climate"
      • "sensor"
      • "remote"
      • "ir_emitter"
      Or to:
      any

      Additional properties are allowed.

      required
      array<object>
      entity_id
      required
      string

      Unique entity identifier.

      entity_type
      required
      string

      Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

      device_id
      string

      Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

      array<string>

      Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

      Items:
      string
      required
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      area
      string

      Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #entity
      • #required

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "resp",
  "req_id": 0,
  "msg": "available_entities",
  "code": 200,
  "msg_data": {
    "filter": {
      "device_id": "string",
      "entity_type": "button"
    },
    "available_entities": [
      {
        "entity_id": "string",
        "entity_type": "string",
        "device_id": "string",
        "features": [
          "string"
        ],
        "name": {},
        "area": "string"
      }
    ]
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #9entity_change

      Entity state change event.

      Emitted when an attribute of an entity changes, e.g. is switched off. Either after an entity_command or if the entity is updated manually through a user or an external system. This keeps the UC Remote in sync with the real state of the entity without the need of constant polling.

      object allOf
      uid: entityStateChangedEvent

      An entity attribute has changed.

      object
      uid: commonEvent

      Common event message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Event message identifier.

      Const:"event"
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      cat
      string

      Event category.

      ts
      string
      format: date-time

      Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

      required
      object

      Wrapper for event data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"entity_change"

      string
      Const:"ENTITY"
      required
      object
      uid: entityStateChanged

      See entity documentation for attributes payload.

      device_id
      string
      entity_type
      required

    • #10entity_available

      New entity available event.

      Optional event to notify the UC Remote that new entities are available.

      object allOf
      uid: entityAvailableEvent
      object
      uid: commonEvent

      Common event message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Event message identifier.

      Const:"event"
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API event message types.

      cat
      string

      Event category.

      ts
      string
      format: date-time

      Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

      required
      object

      Wrapper for event data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"entity_available"
      cat
      string
      Const:"ENTITY"
      required
      object
      uid: entity

      Common definition of an entity. Concrete entities are: cover, button, climate, ir_emitter, light, media_player, remote,sensor, switch.

      See entity documentation for more information.

      The entity_type value acts as discriminator for the entity type, which defines the supported features and options of an entity.
      E.g. a simple button entity supports on / off, whereas a cover entity can be a simple window cover with only the ability to open / close, or a venetian blind with position and tilting features.
      See polymorphism support in AsyncAPI specification for more information.

      entity_id
      required
      string

      Unique entity identifier.

      entity_type
      required
      string

      Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

      device_id
      string

      Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

      array<string>

      Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

      Items:
      string
      required
      object
      uid: languageText
      ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
      (pattern property)
      string

      Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
      If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

      Additional properties are NOT allowed.

      area
      string

      Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      • #entity
      • #event

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "event",
  "msg": "entity_available",
  "cat": "ENTITY",
  "ts": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
  "msg_data": {
    "entity_id": "string",
    "entity_type": "string",
    "device_id": "string",
    "features": [
      "string"
    ],
    "name": {},
    "area": "string"
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.

      Get UC Remote version information.

      implemented in firmware 0.9.2.

      object allOf
      uid: getVersionMsg

      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"get_version"

      uid: versionMsg

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0

      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200

      Wrapper for response data object.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"version"
      required
      object
      uid: versionInfo
      model
      string

      Short model identifier of the remote (UCR2 for Remote Two, UCR3 for Remote 3).

      device_name
      string

      Custom name of the remote

      hostname
      string

      Hostname of the remote

      address
      string

      MAC address of the remote

      api
      string

      API version

      core
      string

      Core app version

      ui
      string

      Frontend app version

      os
      string

      Operating system version

      Additional properties are allowed.

      application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0

    • #13get_supported_entity_types

      Get supported entities in the UC Remote.

      implemented in firmware 0.9.2.

    • #14get_configured_entities

      Retrieve configured entities from this integration.

      implemented in firmware 0.9.2.

      Request the configured entities in the UC Remote originating from this integration. These are all the entities which have been configured in the UC Remote.
      This doesn't mean that all entities are actively being used (assigned in a profile and shown in the user interface).

      This allows the driver e.g. to optimize its device communication and only consider actively used entities.
      Another option for the driver to be notified about used entities is through the subscribe_events requests.

      object allOf
      uid: getConfiguredEntitiesMsg
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"get_configured_entities"

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      Configured entities response.
      description
      The returned entity identifiers are configured in the Remote.
      name
      entity
      object allOf
      uid: configuredEntitiesMsg
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"configured_entities"
      required
      array<string>

      Array of configured entity IDs.

      Items:
      string

      Additional properties are allowed.

      schemaFormat
      application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
      • #entity

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 0,
  "msg": "get_configured_entities"
}
      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #15get_localization_cfg

      Retrieve the localization settings of the UC Remote.

      implemented in firmware 0.9.2.

      The active localization settings of the UC Remote can be used if the integration driver requires localized settings for texts or units of measurements.

      For language texts the driver should always provide an english option in addition to any localized texts.

      object allOf
      uid: getLocalizationMsg
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"get_localization_cfg"

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      Active localization settings of the UC Remote.
      name
      metadata
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      msg
      string
      Const:"localization_cfg"
      object
      uid: localizationSettings
      language_code
      string
      must match: ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$uid: languageCode

      Language culture code: starting with the two-letter ISO-639-1 code, followed by an optional ISO-3166 country code, separated by an underscore. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_DE, de_CH etc.

      country_code
      string
      format: iso-3166uid: countryCode

      Two-letter country codes defined in ISO-3166-1-alpha-2

      time_zone
      string

      Time zone name according to IANA https://www.iana.org/time-zones, e.g. Europe/Copenhagen.

      time_format_24h
      boolean
      Default value:true
      measurement_unit
      string
      uid: measurementUnit
        Allowed values:
      • "METRIC"
      • "US"
      • "UK"

      Additional properties are allowed.

      1 item:
      msg
      2 item:
      msg_data
      schemaFormat
      application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
      • #metadata

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 0,
  "msg": "get_localization_cfg"
}

    • #16get_runtime_info

      Retrieve driver runtime information from the Remote.

      implemented in firmware 0.9.2.

      Request driver runtime information from the Remote. This returns driver and instance identifiers for advanced usage of the REST Core-API. These identifiers could also be propagated to a home automation system to interact with the Remote and REST Core-API.

      object allOf
      uid: getRuntimeInfoMsg
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0

      required
      string

      restricted any

      required
      string
      Const:"get_runtime_info"

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      Driver runtime information from the UC Remote.
      name
      metadata
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      required

      msg
      string
      Const:"runtime_info"
      object
      uid: runtimeInfo
      driver_id
      required
      string

      Identifier under which this integration driver is accessible in the Remote.

      array<string>

      Defined integration instance identifiers of this integration driver in the Remote.
      Only single-device integration drivers are supported at the moment, i.e. there's maximum one integration instance per driver.

      Items:
      string
      log_id
      string

      Log service identifier for a custom integration driver running on the Remote.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      1 item:
      msg
      2 item:
      msg_data

  "kind": "req",
  "id": 0,
  "msg": "get_runtime_info"

      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #17generate_oauth2_auth_url

      Request an OAuth2 authorization URL for the user.

      A new unique authorization URL is created, which may only be used once. Only one active authorization URL per integration is allowed. Old URLs will become invalid if multiple calls are made.

      Once the user has authorized the integration driver by the authorization server, the oauth2_authorization event is emitted.

      The client_data dictionary can be used to encode driver specific data into the URL, which will be returned in the oauth2_authorization event. This allows to link the authorization event to internal driver states, e.g. a setup flow step.

      The following data fields are automatically injected by the core and overwritten if set by an integration:

      • intg: set to the integration driver_id.
      • acc: set to the default integration name.
      • dev: set to the device address, used for the authentication callback URL.

      implemented in firmware 2.2.3.

      object allOf
      uid: generateOauth2AuthUrlMsg
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"generate_oauth2_auth_url"
      required
      object
      required
      object

      Additional key-value pairs which should be encoded into the state query parameter of the authorization request.

      Additional properties:
      string

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      Generated OAuth2 authorization URL.
      name
      oauth2
      object allOf
      uid: oauth2AuthUrlMsg
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"oauth2_auth_url"
      required
      object
      auth_url
      string
      format: uri

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      schemaFormat
      application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
      • #oauth2

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 0,
  "msg": "generate_oauth2_auth_url",
  "msg_data": {
    "client_data": {
      "property1": "string",
      "property2": "string"
    }
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #18create_oauth2_cfg

      Create an OAuth2 configuration entry in the Core.

      implemented in firmware 2.2.3.

      object allOf
      uid: createOauth2CfgMsg
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"create_oauth2_cfg"
      required
      object
      token_id
      required
      string

      Token identifier to use for the OAuth2 token

      name
      required
      string

      Friendly name of the OAuth2 token

      required
      object
      uid: Oauth2Token

      OAuth token response, based on https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-5.1

      access_token
      required
      string

      The access token issued by the authorization server.

      token_type
      required
      string

      The type of the token issued. E.g. Bearer.

      expires_in
      integer

      The time period (in seconds) for which the access_token is valid.

      refresh_token
      string

      The refresh token, which can be used to obtain new access tokens using the same authorization grant.

      scope
      string

      A space-separated list of scopes which have been granted for this access_token.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      Generic response message.
      description
      This message defines the common structure of a response message which is sent back after receiving a request message.
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      schemaFormat
      application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
      • #oauth2

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 0,
  "msg": "create_oauth2_cfg",
  "msg_data": {
    "token_id": "string",
    "name": "string",
    "token": {
      "access_token": "string",
      "token_type": "string",
      "expires_in": 0,
      "refresh_token": "string",
      "scope": "string"
    }
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.
    • #19get_oauth2_token

      Request an OAuth2 access token.

      implemented in firmware 2.2.3.

      object allOf
      uid: getOauth2TokenMsg
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required

      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"get_oauth2_token"
      required
      object
      token_id
      required
      string
      force_refresh
      boolean

      Force a token refresh, no matter if the current token is still valid or not.

      Default value:false

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      OAuth2 access token.
      name
      oauth2
      object allOf
      uid: oauth2TokenMsg
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0

      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      required

      Default value:200

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"oauth2_token"
      required
      object
      token_id
      required
      string
      required
      object
      uid: Oauth2Token

      OAuth token response, based on https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-5.1

      access_token
      required
      string

      The access token issued by the authorization server.

      token_type
      required
      string

      The type of the token issued. E.g. Bearer.

      expires_in
      integer

      The time period (in seconds) for which the access_token is valid.

      refresh_token
      string

      The refresh token, which can be used to obtain new access tokens using the same authorization grant.

      scope
      string

      A space-separated list of scopes which have been granted for this access_token.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      schemaFormat
      application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
      • #oauth2

      {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 0,
  "msg": "get_oauth2_token",
  "msg_data": {
    "token_id": "string",
    "force_refresh": false
  }
}

    • #20delete_oauth2_token

      Delete an OAuth2 access token.

      implemented in firmware 2.2.3.

      object allOf
      uid: deleteOauth2TokenMsg
      object
      uid: commonReq

      Common request message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Request message identifier.

      Const:"req"
      id
      required
      integer
      >= 0

      Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API request message types.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      restricted any
      msg
      required
      string
      Const:"delete_oauth2_token"
      required
      object
      token_id
      required
      string

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      summary
      Command result message.
      description
      A result message is a response message containing a result code and optional error information without further payload.
      object
      uid: commonResp

      Common response message properties.

      kind
      required
      string

      Response message identifier.

      Const:"resp"
      req_id
      required
      integer
      >= 0uid: msgId

      Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

      Default value:0
      msg
      required
      string
      [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

      One of the defined API response message types.

      code
      required
      integer

      Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

      Default value:200
      object

      Wrapper for response data object.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      Additional properties are allowed.

      kind
      resp
      req_id
      123
      msg
      result
      code
      200
      kind
      resp
      req_id
      124
      msg
      result
      code
      400
      code
      INV_ARGUMENT
      message
      Invalid argument. Foo must be a positive number.
      name
      required
      schemaFormat
      application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
      • #oauth2

      Examples

      {
  "kind": "req",
  "id": 0,
  "msg": "delete_oauth2_token",
  "msg_data": {
    "token_id": "string"
  }
}
      This example has been generated automatically.

Messages

  • #1request

    Generic request message.

    This message defines the common structure of a request message. The receiver must reply with a response message.

    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • #2response

    Generic response message.

    This message defines the common structure of a response message which is sent back after receiving a request message.

    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required
    integer

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • #3event

    Generic event message.

    object
    uid: commonEvent

    Common event message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Event message identifier.

    Const:"event"
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API event message types.

    cat
    string

    Event category.

    ts
    string
    format: date-time

    Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

    required
    object

    Wrapper for event data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • #4result

    Command result message.

    A result message is a response message containing a result code and optional error information without further payload.

    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required
    integer

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    • #required
  • #5auth_required

    Authentication request event after connection is established.

    This event is only sent if the integration doesn't support header based authentication during connection setup.
    The UC Remote will then authenticate with the auth request message.

    object allOf
    uid: authRequiredEvent
    object
    uid: commonEvent

    Common event message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Event message identifier.

    Const:"event"
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API event message types.

    cat
    string

    Event category.

    ts
    string
    format: date-time

    Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

    required
    object

    Wrapper for event data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"auth_required"
    object
    uid: driverVersion
    name
    string
    object
    api
    string
    driver
    string

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    • #event
  • #6auth

    Authenticate a connection.

    Sent by the UC Remote after an auth_required request by the integration driver.

    object allOf
    uid: authRequestMsg
    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"auth"
    required
    object
    token
    string

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    summary
    Authentication response.
    description
    The authentication result is provided in the `code` attribute: - `200`: success, API can be used and message requests are accepted. - `401`: authentication failed, the provided token is not valid. The UC Remote will close the connection. The driver should also close the connection after sending this response. If the driver doesn't support or require authentication, it still needs to send the `authentication` message with `code: 200` and `req_id: 0` after the WebSocket connection has been established by the UC Remote. It's recommended to send the optional driver version object in the the msg_data payload to avoid eventual additional message exchanges.
    object allOf
    uid: authMsg
    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required
    integer

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"authentication"
    object
    uid: driverVersion
    name
    string
    object
    api
    string
    driver
    string

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    name
    required
    schemaFormat
    application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
  • #7authentication

    Authentication response.

    The authentication result is provided in the code attribute:

    • 200: success, API can be used and message requests are accepted.
    • 401: authentication failed, the provided token is not valid.
      The UC Remote will close the connection. The driver should also close the connection after sending this response.

    If the driver doesn't support or require authentication, it still needs to send the authentication message with code: 200 and req_id: 0 after the WebSocket connection has been established by the UC Remote.

    It's recommended to send the optional driver version object in the the msg_data payload to avoid eventual additional message exchanges.

    object allOf
    uid: authMsg
    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required
    integer

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"authentication"
    object
    uid: driverVersion
    name
    string
    object
    api
    string
    driver
    string

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    • #required

  • #10get_driver_metadata

    Retrieve the integration driver metadata.

    The metadata is used to setup the driver in the remote / web-configurator and start the setup flow.

    object allOf
    uid: getDriverMetadataMsg
    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"get_driver_metadata"

    Additional properties are allowed.

    summary
    Integration driver metadata response.
    name
    metadata
    name
    required
    object allOf
    uid: driverMetadataMsg
    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required
    integer

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"driver_metadata"
    required
    object
    uid: driverMetadata

    Integration driver metadata.

    driver_id
    required
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    driver_url
    string
    format: uri<= 2048 characters

    Optional WebSocket URL of the driver to override mDNS information.

    auth_method
    string
    uid: intgAuthMethod

    Integration driver authentication method if a token is required.

    The JSON auth message is used if a token is configured but no authentication method is set.

      Allowed values:
    • "HEADER"
    • "MESSAGE"
    version
    required
    string
    <= 20 characters

    Driver version, SemVer preferred.

    min_core_api
    string
    <= 20 characters

    Optional version check: minimum required Core-API version in the remote.

    icon
    string
    <= 255 charactersuid: iconIdentifier

    Optional icon identifier. If specified the icon will be set. An empty identifier while updating the object removes the existing icon.

    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    object
    uid: driverDeveloper

    Optional information about the integration developer.

    name
    string
    <= 50 characters

    Optional developer information to display in UI / web-configurator.

    url
    string
    format: uri<= 255 characters

    Optional developer home page.

    email
    string
    format: email<= 100 characters

    Optional developer contact email.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    home_page
    string
    format: uri<= 255 characters

    Optional home page url for more information.

    device_discovery
    boolean

    Driver supports multi-device discovery. Not yet supported.

    object
    uid: DriverManifest

    The driver manifest contains required and optional features for the driver to work.

    Furthermore, it can also contain additional metadata for the Core service, which is required for certain features. For example OAuth2 configuration data like the authorization and token endpoints. This data may only be transmitted to the core, but won't be exposed in the driver management API endpoints.

    array<object>

    Required features of an integration driver.

    name
    required
    string
    <= 50 characters

    Feature name

    required
    boolean

    Optional or required feature

    Default value:true
    object

    Feature specific data

    Additional properties are allowed.

    iot_class
    string
    uid: IotClass

    How the integration connects and communicates with a device or service. Inspired by Home Assistant IoT class.

      Allowed values:
    • "assumed_state"
    • "cloud_polling"
    • "cloud_push"
    • "local_polling"
    • "local_push"

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    uid: SettingsPage

    Settings definition page, e.g. to configure an integration driver.

    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    required
    array<object>

    One or multiple input field definitions, with optional pre-set values.

    id
    required
    string
    <= 50

    Unique identifier of the setting to be returned with the entered value.

    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    required
    oneOf
    object
    uid: SettingTypeNumber

    Number input with optional min, max, steps and decimals properties. The default value must be specified in value. An optional unit of the number setting can be specified in units, which will be displayed next to the input field.

    required
    object
    value
    required
    number

    Default value for input field.

    min
    number

    Optional validation: minimum allowed value (inclusive).

    max
    number

    Optional validation: maximum allowed value (inclusive).

    steps
    number

    Optional validation: allowed step increment between values. Might also be used in the UI for input helpers.

    decimals
    integer
    >= 0

    Number of decimal places. 0 = integer value

    Default value:0
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    uid: SettingTypePassword

    string
    <= 50

    Unique identifier of the setting to be returned with the entered value.

    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    required
    oneOf
    object
    uid: SettingTypeNumber

    Number input with optional min, max, steps and decimals properties. The default value must be specified in value. An optional unit of the number setting can be specified in units, which will be displayed next to the input field.

    required
    object

    required

    Default value for input field.

  • #13exit_standby

    UC Remote leaves standby event.

    Notification event that the UC Remote is out of standby. The integration should resume operation if it suspended it while receiving the enter_standby event.
    This allows the integration to submit any entity state changes. Otherwise the UC Remote will likely request an entity state update.

    object allOf
    uid: exitStandbyEvent
    object

  • #14connect

    Event to establish connection to entities or devices.

    Optional: this event instructs the integration to establish the required connections to interact with the provided entities or devices.

    The integration should send device_state events to inform the UC Remote about the connection state.

    object allOf
    uid: connectEvent

    For simple drivers without dynamic devices the msg_data object can be omitted. In this case, the connect event is for the overall integration driver and not for a specific device.

    object
    uid: commonEvent

  • #15disconnect

    Event to stop the connection to entities or devices.

    Optional: this event instructs the integration to stop the interactions with the provided entities or devices, because the UC Remote temporarily doesn't need the entities. It's up to the integration what to do, but it needs to be prepared to react on a connect event.

    The integration should send device_state events to inform the UC Remote about the connection state.

    object allOf
    uid: disconnectEvent

    For simple drivers without dynamic devices the msg_data object can be omitted. In this case, the disconnect event is for the overall integration driver and not for a specific device.

    object
    uid: commonEvent

    Common event message properties.

  • #16get_device_state

    Get the current integration driver or device state.

    Called by the UC Remote when it needs to synchronize the device state, e.g. after waking up from standby, or if it doesn't receive regular device_state events.

    The device_id property is only required if the driver supports multiple device instances.

    Note: this request will not be answered with a response message but with an event.

    object allOf
    uid: getDeviceStateMsg

    For simple drivers without dynamic devices the msg_data object can be omitted. In this case, the request is for the overall integration driver and not for a specific device.

    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"get_device_state"
    object
    device_id
    string

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    summary
    Current integration driver or device state event.
    description
    If there's a device communication issue or other error, this state will inform the user with a UI notification about the issue. This event should be triggered by the integration driver whenever the state changes. Furthermore, the UC Remote can request the current state with the `get_device_state` request.
    name
    device
    name
    required
    object allOf

  • #18setup_driver

    Start driver setup.

    If a driver includes a setup_data_schema object in its driver metadata, it enables the dynamic driver setup process. The setup process can be a simple "start-confirm-done" between the UC Remote and the integration driver, or a fully dynamic, multi-step process with user interactions, where the user has to provide additional data or select different options.

    The reconfigure flag indicates if the user wants to reconfigure an already configured driver in the Remote. It's up to the driver on how to handle a reconfiguration request and run a different logic. For example, this allows to show an options screen to change certain values, or present the option to modify, add or delete provided device entities.

    After confirming the setup_driver request, the integration driver has to send driver_setup_change events:

    • event_type: SETUP with state: SETUP is a progress event to keep the process running, see below.
    • event_type: SETUP with state: WAIT_USER_ACTION can be sent to the UC Remote to request a user interaction: either a confirmation to press next to continue the process, or input values.
    • event_type: STOP with event: OK finishes the setup process and the UC Remote creates an integration instance.
    • event_type: STOP with event: ERROR aborts the setup process.

    If the setup process takes more than a few seconds, the integration should send driver_setup_change events with state: SETUP to the UC Remote to show a setup progress to the user and prevent an inactivity timeout.
    Default setup timeouts:

    • Setup progress (watchdog): 60 seconds. If no setup message is received within that time, the setup process is aborted.
    • User action timeout: 3 minutes. If there's no user response within that time, the setup process is aborted.
    • Overall setup timeout: 5 minutes. The setup process is automatically aborted if it is still running after that time.

    If no setup is needed, but the integration driver requires to show additional information to the user before the integration is setup (e.g. terms & conditions, further help information or web links, etc.), it can define an "information settings page" with text labels in setup_data_schema without any input fields. In this case the integration simply has to respond with a driver_setup_change event message with event_type: STOP and state: OK after confirming the setup_driver request message.

    object allOf
    uid: setupDriverMsg
    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"setup_driver"
    required
    object
    reconfigure
    boolean

    If set to true: reconfigure an already configured driver.

    required
    object
    uid: SettingsValues

    User input result of a SettingsPage as key values.

    • key: id of the field
    • value: entered user value as string. This is either the entered text or number, selected checkbox state or the selected dropdown item id.
      Non native string values as numbers or booleans are represented as string values!
    Additional properties:
    string

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    summary
    Command result message.
    description
    A result message is a response message containing a result code and optional error information without further payload.
    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required
    integer

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    kind
    resp
    req_id
    123
    msg
    result
    code
    200
    kind
    resp
    req_id
    124
    msg
    result
    code
    400
    code
    INV_ARGUMENT
    message
    Invalid argument. Foo must be a positive number.
    name

    schemaFormat

  • #19abort_driver_setup

    Abort a driver setup.

    If the user aborts the setup process, the UC Remote sends this event. Further messages from the integration from the setup process will be ignored afterwards.

    object allOf
    uid: abortDriverSetupEvent
    object
    uid: commonEvent

    Common event message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Const:"event"

    Const:"abort_driver_setup"

    Const:"DEVICE"
    required

    error
    required
    string
    uid: integrationSetupError

    More detailed error reason for state: ERROR condition.

      Allowed values:
    • "NONE"
    • "NOT_FOUND"
    • "CONNECTION_REFUSED"
    • "AUTHORIZATION_ERROR"
    • "TIMEOUT"
    • "OTHER"

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    • #setup
    • #event
  • #20driver_setup_change

    Driver setup state change event.

    Emitted for all driver setup flow state changes.

    Different change events:

    • SETUP: send progress, setup is still running
    • WAIT_USER_ACTION: integration driver requires user input
    • OK: integration setup successfully completed
    • ERROR: integration setup failed
    object allOf
    uid: driverSetupChangeEvent
    object
    uid: commonEvent

    Common event message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Event message identifier.

    Const:"event"
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API event message types.

    cat
    string

    Event category.

    ts
    string
    format: date-time

    Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

    required
    object

    Wrapper for event data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"driver_setup_change"
    cat
    string
    Const:"DEVICE"
    required
    object
    uid: driverSetupChange
    event_type
    required
    string
    • START: setup started
    • SETUP: setup in progress. See state enum for current setup state.
    • STOP: setup finished, either with: state: OK for successful setup, or state: ERROR if setup didn't completed successfully.
      Allowed values:
    • "START"
    • "SETUP"
    • "STOP"
    state
    required
    string
    uid: integrationSetupState
    • SETUP: setup in progress
    • WAIT_USER_ACTION: setup flow is waiting for user input. See require_user_action for requested input.
    • OK: setup finished successfully
    • ERROR: setup error
      Allowed values:
    • "SETUP"
    • "WAIT_USER_ACTION"
    • "OK"
    • "ERROR"
    error
    string
    uid: integrationSetupError

    More detailed error reason for state: ERROR condition.

      Allowed values:
    • "NONE"
    • "NOT_FOUND"
    • "CONNECTION_REFUSED"
    • "AUTHORIZATION_ERROR"
    • "TIMEOUT"
    • "OTHER"
    object oneOf

    If set, the setup process waits for the specified user action.

    object
    required
    object
    uid: SettingsPage

    Settings definition page, e.g. to configure an integration driver.

    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    required
    array<object>

    One or multiple input field definitions, with optional pre-set values.

    id
    required
    string
    <= 50

    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    • #setup
    • #event
  • #21set_driver_user_data

    Provide requested driver setup data.

    Set required data to configure the integration driver or continue the setup process.

    Defined user actions to set in the request body action field:

    • input_values: if the user was requested to enter settings, e.g. connection or credential parameters to a device or service.
    • confirm: response to the user action confirmation. Set to true if the user had to perform an action like pressing a button on a device and then confirms the action with continuing the setup process.
      The false value is not yet used but might be used in the future for yes / no choices.

    The state field in the response message indicate the current state of the setup process.

    object allOf
    uid: setDriverUserDataMsg
    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"set_driver_user_data"
    required
    object oneOf
    object
    required
    object
    uid: SettingsValues

    User input result of a SettingsPage as key values.

    • key: id of the field
    • value: entered user value as string. This is either the entered text or number, selected checkbox state or the selected dropdown item id.
      Non native string values as numbers or booleans are represented as string values!
    Additional properties:
    string

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    confirm
    required
    boolean

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    summary
    Command result message.
    description
    A result message is a response message containing a result code and optional error information without further payload.
    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required
    integer

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    kind
    resp
    req_id
    123
    msg
    result
    code
    200
    kind
    resp
    req_id
    124
    msg
    result
    code
    400

    INV_ARGUMENT
    message
    Invalid argument. Foo must be a positive number.
    name

    schemaFormat
    application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
    • #setup
  • #22get_available_entities

    Retrieve the available entities from the integration driver.

    Called while configuring profiles and assigning entities to pages or groups in the web-configurator or the embedded editor of the remote UI.

    With the optional filter, only entities of a given type can be requested.

    object allOf
    uid: getAvailableEntitiesMsg
    • TODO add paging: worst case this could include hundreds if not thousands of entities!
    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"get_available_entities"
    object
    object
    uid: availableEntityFilter

    Optional filters

    device_id
    string

    Optional device instance filter if driver supports multi instances.

    string anyOf
    uid: entityType

    Supported entities, defined as extensible enum: already known entity types are in the enum, but other string values are allowed for forward compatability.

    Can adhere to:
    string
      Allowed values:
    • "button"
    • "switch"
    • "light"
    • "cover"
    • "media_player"
    • "climate"
    • "sensor"
    • "remote"
    • "ir_emitter"
    Or to:
    any

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    summary
    Available entities response.
    description
    This message contains the available entities from the integration driver the UC Remote can configure. If the `get_available_entities` request included a filter, it is returned in the message data with only the matching entities.
    name
    entity
    name
    required
    object allOf
    uid: availableEntitiesMsg
    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required
    integer

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"available_entities"
    required
    object
    object
    uid: availableEntityFilter

    Optional filters

    device_id
    string

    Optional device instance filter if driver supports multi instances.

    string anyOf
    uid: entityType

    Supported entities, defined as extensible enum: already known entity types are in the enum, but other string values are allowed for forward compatability.

    Can adhere to:
    string
      Allowed values:
    • "button"
    • "switch"
    • "light"
    • "cover"
    • "media_player"
    • "climate"
    • "sensor"
    • "remote"
    • "ir_emitter"
    Or to:
    any

    Additional properties are allowed.

    required
    array<object>
    entity_id
    required
    string

    Unique entity identifier.

    entity_type
    required
    string

    Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

    device_id
    string

    Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

    array<string>

    Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

    Items:
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    area
    string

    Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    schemaFormat
    application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
    • #entity
    • #required

  • #24subscribe_events

    Subscribe to events.

    Subscribe to entity state change events to receive entity_change events from the integration driver.

    If no entity IDs are specified then events for all available entities are sent to the UC Remote.

    object allOf
    uid: subscribeEventsMsg
    object
    uid: commonReq

    Only required for multi-device integrations.

  • #25unsubscribe_events

    Unsubscribe from events.

    If no entity IDs are specified then all events for all available entities are stopped.

    This message is sent by the UC Remote if a previously configured entity is no longer used and therefore no longer interested in entity updates. If the integration driver keeps sending events for the unsubscribed entities then they are simply discarded.

    object allOf
    uid: unsubscribeEventsMsg
    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required

    >= 0

  • #28get_supported_entity_types

    Get supported entities in the UC Remote.

    implemented in firmware 0.9.2.

    This is a metadata request for supported entities in the UC Remote and allows the client to check if it's still compatible. New releases can support new entities or entities might get renamed in major updates.

  • #30get_configured_entities

    Retrieve configured entities from this integration.

    implemented in firmware 0.9.2.

    Request the configured entities in the UC Remote originating from this integration. These are all the entities which have been configured in the UC Remote.
    This doesn't mean that all entities are actively being used (assigned in a profile and shown in the user interface).

    This allows the driver e.g. to optimize its device communication and only consider actively used entities.
    Another option for the driver to be notified about used entities is through the subscribe_events requests.

    object allOf
    uid: getConfiguredEntitiesMsg
    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"get_configured_entities"

    Additional properties are allowed.

    summary
    Configured entities response.
    description
    The returned entity identifiers are configured in the Remote.
    name
    entity
    object allOf
    uid: configuredEntitiesMsg
    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required
    integer

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"configured_entities"
    required
    array<string>

    Array of configured entity IDs.

    Items:
    string

    Additional properties are allowed.

    schemaFormat
    application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
    • #entity

  • #32get_localization_cfg

    Retrieve the localization settings of the UC Remote.

    implemented in firmware 0.9.2.

    The active localization settings of the UC Remote can be used if the integration driver requires localized settings for texts or units of measurements.

    For language texts the driver should always provide an english option in addition to any localized texts.

    object allOf
    uid: getLocalizationMsg
    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"get_localization_cfg"

    Additional properties are allowed.

    summary
    Active localization settings of the UC Remote.
    name
    metadata
    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required
    integer

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    msg
    string
    Const:"localization_cfg"
    object
    uid: localizationSettings
    language_code
    string
    must match: ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$uid: languageCode

    Language culture code: starting with the two-letter ISO-639-1 code, followed by an optional ISO-3166 country code, separated by an underscore. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_DE, de_CH etc.

    country_code
    string
    format: iso-3166uid: countryCode

    Two-letter country codes defined in ISO-3166-1-alpha-2

    time_zone
    string

    Time zone name according to IANA https://www.iana.org/time-zones, e.g. Europe/Copenhagen.

    time_format_24h
    boolean
    Default value:true
    measurement_unit
    string
    uid: measurementUnit
      Allowed values:
    • "METRIC"
    • "US"
    • "UK"

    Additional properties are allowed.

    1 item:
    msg
    2 item:
    msg_data
    schemaFormat
    application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
    • #metadata
  • #33localization_cfg

    Active localization settings of the UC Remote.

    allOf
    uid: localizationMsg
    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required
    integer

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"localization_cfg"
    required
    object
    uid: localizationSettings
    language_code
    string
    must match: ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$uid: languageCode

    Language culture code: starting with the two-letter ISO-639-1 code, followed by an optional ISO-3166 country code, separated by an underscore. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_DE, de_CH etc.

    country_code
    string
    format: iso-3166uid: countryCode

    Two-letter country codes defined in ISO-3166-1-alpha-2

    time_zone
    string

    Time zone name according to IANA https://www.iana.org/time-zones, e.g. Europe/Copenhagen.

    time_format_24h
    boolean
    Default value:true
    measurement_unit
    string
    uid: measurementUnit
      Allowed values:
    • "METRIC"
    • "US"
    • "UK"

    Additional properties are allowed.

    • #metadata
  • #34get_runtime_info

    Retrieve driver runtime information from the Remote.

    implemented in firmware 0.9.2.

    Request driver runtime information from the Remote. This returns driver and instance identifiers for advanced usage of the REST Core-API. These identifiers could also be propagated to a home automation system to interact with the Remote and REST Core-API.

    object allOf
    uid: getRuntimeInfoMsg
    object

    • #metadata
  • #36get_entity_states

    Get the current state of the configured entities.

    Called by the UC Remote when it needs to synchronize the dynamic entity attributes, e.g. after connection setup or waking up from standby.

    The integration should only send the state of the configured entities to reduce communication overhead, especially if there are many available entities, from which only a few are getting configured on the remote.
    Any additional data will be ignored.

    Furthermore, the integration driver is free to decide which entity states it wants to send back. It's even advisable to use dirty flags in the integration driver if there are a lot of entities, and only return the changed data.

    Future change announcement: this request will be enhanced with a force flag (or the like) to signal that all entity states are required, and no data should be suppressed. This will happen for example after the remote is restarted.

    object allOf
    uid: getEntityStatesMsg

    For simple drivers without dynamic devices the msg_data.device_id property can be omitted. In this case, the request is for the overall integration driver and not for a specific device.

    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"get_entity_states"
    object
    device_id
    string

    Only required for multi-device integrations.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    summary
    Current state of the entities.
    description
    Response message of the `get_entity_states` request. Contains the dynamic attributes of all entities.
    name
    entity
    name
    required
    object allOf
    uid: entityStatesMsg

    The msg_data payload is an array of the entity_change event.

    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg

    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"entity_states"
    required
    array<object>
    device_id
