  • #38entity_command

    Execute an entity command.

    Instruct the integration driver to execute a command like "turn on" or "change temperature". Optional command data like temperature value or channel number can be provided in the params array. The parameter objects are described in the entity feature definitions.

    The result response is to acknowledge the command and to return any immediate failures in case the driver already knows it's unable to perform the command due to invalid data, device communication issues etc.

    After successfully executing a command, the UC Remote expects an entity_change event with the updated feature value(s).

    object allOf
    uid: entityCommandMsg
    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"entity_command"
    required
    object
    device_id
    string
    entity_id
    required
    string
    cmd_id
    required
    string
    object

    See https://github.com/unfoldedcircle/core-api/tree/main/doc/entities for command parameter definitions.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    summary
    Command result message.
    description
    A result message is a response message containing a result code and optional error information without further payload.
    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required
    integer

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    kind
    resp
    req_id
    123
    msg
    result
    code
    200
    kind
    resp
    req_id
    124
    msg
    result
    code
    400
    code
    INV_ARGUMENT
    message
    Invalid argument. Foo must be a positive number.
    name
    required
    schemaFormat
    application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
    • #entity
    • #required
  • #39generate_oauth2_auth_url

    Request an OAuth2 authorization URL for the user.

    A new unique authorization URL is created, which may only be used once. Only one active authorization URL per integration is allowed. Old URLs will become invalid if multiple calls are made.

    Once the user has authorized the integration driver by the authorization server, the oauth2_authorization event is emitted.

    The client_data dictionary can be used to encode driver specific data into the URL, which will be returned in the oauth2_authorization event. This allows to link the authorization event to internal driver states, e.g. a setup flow step.

    The following data fields are automatically injected by the core and overwritten if set by an integration:

    • intg: set to the integration driver_id.
    • acc: set to the default integration name.
    • dev: set to the device address, used for the authentication callback URL.

    implemented in firmware 2.2.3.

    object allOf
    uid: generateOauth2AuthUrlMsg
    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"generate_oauth2_auth_url"
    required
    object
    required
    object

    Additional key-value pairs which should be encoded into the state query parameter of the authorization request.

    Additional properties:
    string

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    summary
    Generated OAuth2 authorization URL.
    name
    oauth2
    object allOf
    uid: oauth2AuthUrlMsg
    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required

    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any

    Const:"oauth2_auth_url"

    format: uri

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0

    Create an OAuth2 configuration entry in the Core.

    implemented in firmware 2.2.3.

    object allOf
    uid: createOauth2CfgMsg
    object
    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"create_oauth2_cfg"
    required
    object
    token_id
    required
    string

    Token identifier to use for the OAuth2 token

    name
    required
    string

    Friendly name of the OAuth2 token

    required
    object
    uid: Oauth2Token

    OAuth token response, based on https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-5.1

    access_token
    required
    string

    The access token issued by the authorization server.

    token_type
    required
    string

    The type of the token issued. E.g. Bearer.

    expires_in
    integer

    The time period (in seconds) for which the access_token is valid.

    refresh_token
    string

    The refresh token, which can be used to obtain new access tokens using the same authorization grant.

    scope
    string

    A space-separated list of scopes which have been granted for this access_token.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    summary
    Generic response message.
    description
    This message defines the common structure of a response message which is sent back after receiving a request message.
    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    code
    required
    integer

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0

  • #44oauth2_authorization

    Event that user has authorized the service.

    This event is sent after the user has authorized the service. If the authorization was successful, the Core retrieves the initial token for the integration to retrieve further information and setup the integration driver.

    If authorization or token retrieval failed, the error field is set.

    The returned token is not saved in the Core. An integration driver has to use create_oauth2_cfg to persist an OAuth2 authorization for future use.

    implemented in firmware 2.2.3.

    object allOf
    uid: oauth2AuthorizedEvent
    object
    uid: commonEvent

    Common event message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Event message identifier.

    Const:"event"
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API event message types.

    cat
    string

    Event category.

    ts
    string
    format: date-time

    Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

    required
    object

    Wrapper for event data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"oauth2_authorization"
    cat
    string
    Const:"REMOTE"
    required
    object
    required
    object

    Provided key-value pairs in the authorization request URL.

    Additional properties:
    string
    error_code
    string
    error_description
    string
    object
    uid: Oauth2Token

    OAuth token response, based on https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-5.1

    access_token
    required
    string

    The access token issued by the authorization server.

    token_type
    required
    string

    The type of the token issued. E.g. Bearer.

    expires_in
    integer

    The time period (in seconds) for which the access_token is valid.

    refresh_token
    string

    The refresh token, which can be used to obtain new access tokens using the same authorization grant.

    scope
    string

    A space-separated list of scopes which have been granted for this access_token.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    • #oauth2

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"delete_oauth2_token"
    required

    token_id
    required
    string

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    summary
    Command result message.
    description
    A result message is a response message containing a result code and optional error information without further payload.
    object
    uid: commonResp

    Common response message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Response message identifier.

    Const:"resp"
    req_id
    required
    integer
    >= 0uid: msgId

    Request message ID which is reflected in response message.

    Default value:0

    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API response message types.

    required

    Response code of the operation according to HTTP status codes.

    Default value:200
    object

    Wrapper for response data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    kind
    resp
    req_id
    123
    msg
    result
    code
    200
    kind
    resp
    req_id
    124
    msg
    result
    code
    400
    code
    INV_ARGUMENT
    message
    Invalid argument. Foo must be a positive number.
    name
    required
    schemaFormat
    application/vnd.aai.asyncapi;version=2.2.0
    • #oauth2
  • #47entity_change

    Entity state change event.

    Emitted when an attribute of an entity changes, e.g. is switched off. Either after an entity_command or if the entity is updated manually through a user or an external system. This keeps the UC Remote in sync with the real state of the entity without the need of constant polling.

    object allOf
    uid: entityStateChangedEvent

    An entity attribute has changed.

    object
    uid: commonEvent

    Common event message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Event message identifier.

    Const:"event"
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API event message types.

    cat
    string

    Event category.

    ts
    string
    format: date-time

    Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

    required
    object

    Wrapper for event data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"entity_change"
    cat
    string
    Const:"ENTITY"
    required
    object
    uid: entityStateChanged

    See entity documentation for attributes payload.

    device_id
    string
    entity_type
    required
    string
    entity_id
    required
    string
    required
    object

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    • #entity
    • #event
    • #required
  • #48entity_available

    New entity available event.

    Optional event to notify the UC Remote that new entities are available.

    object allOf
    uid: entityAvailableEvent
    object
    uid: commonEvent

    Common event message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Event message identifier.

    Const:"event"
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API event message types.

    cat
    string

    Event category.

    ts
    string
    format: date-time

    Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

    required
    object

    Wrapper for event data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"entity_available"
    cat
    string
    Const:"ENTITY"
    required
    object
    uid: entity

    Common definition of an entity. Concrete entities are: cover, button, climate, ir_emitter, light, media_player, remote,sensor, switch.

    See entity documentation for more information.

    The entity_type value acts as discriminator for the entity type, which defines the supported features and options of an entity.
    E.g. a simple button entity supports on / off, whereas a cover entity can be a simple window cover with only the ability to open / close, or a venetian blind with position and tilting features.
    See polymorphism support in AsyncAPI specification for more information.

    entity_id
    required
    string

    Unique entity identifier.

    entity_type
    required
    string

    Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

    device_id
    string

    Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

    array<string>

    Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

    Items:
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    area
    string

    Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    • #entity
    • #event
  • #49entity_removed

    uid: driverMetadata

    Integration driver metadata.

    driver_id
    required
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    driver_url
    string
    format: uri<= 2048 characters

    Optional WebSocket URL of the driver to override mDNS information.

    auth_method
    string
    uid: intgAuthMethod

    Integration driver authentication method if a token is required.

    The JSON auth message is used if a token is configured but no authentication method is set.

      Allowed values:
    • "HEADER"
    • "MESSAGE"
    version
    required
    string
    <= 20 characters

    Driver version, SemVer preferred.

    min_core_api
    string
    <= 20 characters

    Optional version check: minimum required Core-API version in the remote.

    icon
    string
    <= 255 charactersuid: iconIdentifier

    Optional icon identifier. If specified the icon will be set. An empty identifier while updating the object removes the existing icon.

    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    object
    uid: driverDeveloper

    Optional information about the integration developer.

    name
    string
    <= 50 characters

    Optional developer information to display in UI / web-configurator.

    url
    string
    format: uri<= 255 characters

    Optional developer home page.

    email
    string
    format: email<= 100 characters

    Optional developer contact email.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    home_page
    string
    format: uri<= 255 characters

    Optional home page url for more information.

    device_discovery
    boolean

    Driver supports multi-device discovery. Not yet supported.

    object
    uid: DriverManifest

    The driver manifest contains required and optional features for the driver to work.

    Furthermore, it can also contain additional metadata for the Core service, which is required for certain features. For example OAuth2 configuration data like the authorization and token endpoints. This data may only be transmitted to the core, but won't be exposed in the driver management API endpoints.

    array<object>

    Required features of an integration driver.

    name
    required
    string
    <= 50 characters

    Feature name

    required
    boolean

    Optional or required feature

    Default value:true
    object

    Feature specific data

    Additional properties are allowed.

    iot_class
    string
    uid: IotClass

    How the integration connects and communicates with a device or service. Inspired by Home Assistant IoT class.

      Allowed values:
    • "assumed_state"
    • "cloud_polling"
    • "cloud_push"
    • "local_polling"
    • "local_push"

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    uid: SettingsPage

    Settings definition page, e.g. to configure an integration driver.

    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    required
    array<object>

    One or multiple input field definitions, with optional pre-set values.

    id
    required
    string
    <= 50

    Unique identifier of the setting to be returned with the entered value.

    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    required
    oneOf
    object
    uid: SettingTypeNumber

    Number input with optional min, max, steps and decimals properties. The default value must be specified in value. An optional unit of the number setting can be specified in units, which will be displayed next to the input field.

    required
    object
    value
    required
    number

    Default value for input field.

    min
    number

    Optional validation: minimum allowed value (inclusive).

    max
    number

    Optional validation: maximum allowed value (inclusive).

    steps
    number

    Optional validation: allowed step increment between values. Might also be used in the UI for input helpers.

    decimals
    integer
    >= 0

    Number of decimal places. 0 = integer value

    Default value:0
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    uid: getDeviceStateMsg

    For simple drivers without dynamic devices the msg_data object can be omitted. In this case, the request is for the overall integration driver and not for a specific device.

    kind
    required

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"

    required

    >= 0

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"setup_driver"
    required
    object
    reconfigure
    boolean

    If set to true: reconfigure an already configured driver.

    required
    object
    uid: SettingsValues

    User input result of a SettingsPage as key values.

    • key: id of the field
    • value: entered user value as string. This is either the entered text or number, selected checkbox state or the selected dropdown item id.
      Non native string values as numbers or booleans are represented as string values!
    Additional properties:
    string

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • object allOf
    uid: driverSetupChangeEvent
    object
    uid: commonEvent

    Common event message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Event message identifier.

    Const:"event"
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API event message types.

    cat
    string

    Event category.

    ts
    string
    format: date-time

    Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

    required
    object

    Wrapper for event data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"driver_setup_change"
    cat
    string
    Const:"DEVICE"
    required
    object
    uid: driverSetupChange
    event_type
    required
    string
    • START: setup started
    • SETUP: setup in progress. See state enum for current setup state.
    • STOP: setup finished, either with: state: OK for successful setup, or state: ERROR if setup didn't completed successfully.
      Allowed values:
    • "START"
    • "SETUP"
    • "STOP"
    state
    required
    string
    uid: integrationSetupState
    • SETUP: setup in progress
    • WAIT_USER_ACTION: setup flow is waiting for user input. See require_user_action for requested input.
    • OK: setup finished successfully
    • ERROR: setup error
      Allowed values:
    • "SETUP"
    • "WAIT_USER_ACTION"
    • "OK"
    • "ERROR"
    error
    string
    uid: integrationSetupError

    More detailed error reason for state: ERROR condition.

      Allowed values:
    • "NONE"
    • "NOT_FOUND"
    • "CONNECTION_REFUSED"
    • "AUTHORIZATION_ERROR"
    • "TIMEOUT"
    • "OTHER"
    object oneOf

    If set, the setup process waits for the specified user action.

    object
    required
    object
    uid: SettingsPage

    Settings definition page, e.g. to configure an integration driver.

    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    required
    array<object>

    One or multiple input field definitions, with optional pre-set values.

    id
    required
    string
    <= 50

    Unique identifier of the setting to be returned with the entered value.

    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    required
    oneOf
    object
    uid: SettingTypeNumber

    Number input with optional min, max, steps and decimals properties. The default value must be specified in value. An optional unit of the number setting can be specified in units, which will be displayed next to the input field.

    required
    object
    value
    required
    number

    Default value for input field.

    min
    number

    Optional validation: minimum allowed value (inclusive).

    max
    number

    Optional validation: maximum allowed value (inclusive).

    steps
    number

    Optional validation: allowed step increment between values. Might also be used in the UI for input helpers.

    decimals
    integer
    >= 0

    Number of decimal places. 0 = integer value

    Default value:0
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    required

    object
    required
    object
    uid: SettingsValues

    User input result of a SettingsPage as key values.

    • key: id of the field
    • value: entered user value as string. This is either the entered text or number, selected checkbox state or the selected dropdown item id.
      Non native string values as numbers or booleans are represented as string values!
    Additional properties:
    string

    Additional properties are allowed.

    string anyOf
    uid: entityType

    Supported entities, defined as extensible enum: already known entity types are in the enum, but other string values are allowed for forward compatability.

    Can adhere to:
    string
      Allowed values:
    • "button"
    • "switch"
    • "light"
    • "cover"
    • "media_player"

    required

    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    area
    string

    Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

    object
    uid: localizationSettings
    language_code
    string
    must match: ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$uid: languageCode

    Language culture code: starting with the two-letter ISO-639-1 code, followed by an optional ISO-3166 country code, separated by an underscore. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_DE, de_CH etc.

    country_code
    string
    format: iso-3166uid: countryCode

    Two-letter country codes defined in ISO-3166-1-alpha-2

    time_zone
    string

    Time zone name according to IANA https://www.iana.org/time-zones, e.g. Europe/Copenhagen.

    time_format_24h
    boolean
    Default value:true
    measurement_unit
    string
    uid: measurementUnit
      Allowed values:
    • "METRIC"
    • "US"
    • "UK"

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"create_oauth2_cfg"
    required
    object
    token_id
    required
    string

    Token identifier to use for the OAuth2 token

    name
    required
    string

    Friendly name of the OAuth2 token

    required
    object
    uid: Oauth2Token

    OAuth token response, based on https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-5.1

    access_token
    required
    string

    The access token issued by the authorization server.

    token_type
    required
    string

    The type of the token issued. E.g. Bearer.

    expires_in
    integer

    The time period (in seconds) for which the access_token is valid.

    refresh_token
    string

    The refresh token, which can be used to obtain new access tokens using the same authorization grant.

    scope
    string

    A space-separated list of scopes which have been granted for this access_token.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • object allOf
    uid: getOauth2TokenMsg

    uid: commonReq

    Common request message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Request message identifier.

    Const:"req"
    id
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Request ID which must be increased for every new request. This ID will be returned in the response message.

    Default value:0
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API request message types.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"get_oauth2_token"
    required
    object
    token_id
    required
    string
    force_refresh
    boolean

    Force a token refresh, no matter if the current token is still valid or not.

    Default value:false

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • object allOf
    uid: connectEvent

    For simple drivers without dynamic devices the msg_data object can be omitted. In this case, the connect event is for the overall integration driver and not for a specific device.

  • object allOf
    uid: entityAvailableEvent
    object
    uid: commonEvent

    Common event message properties.

    kind
    required
    string

    Event message identifier.

    Const:"event"
    msg
    required
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters

    One of the defined API event message types.

    cat
    string

    Event category.

    ts
    string
    format: date-time

    Optional timestamp when the event was generated.

    required
    object

    Wrapper for event data object.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    restricted any
    msg
    required
    string
    Const:"entity_available"
    cat
    string
    Const:"ENTITY"
    required
    object
    uid: entity

    Common definition of an entity. Concrete entities are: cover, button, climate, ir_emitter, light, media_player, remote,sensor, switch.

    See entity documentation for more information.

    The entity_type value acts as discriminator for the entity type, which defines the supported features and options of an entity.
    E.g. a simple button entity supports on / off, whereas a cover entity can be a simple window cover with only the ability to open / close, or a venetian blind with position and tilting features.
    See polymorphism support in AsyncAPI specification for more information.

    entity_id
    required
    string

    Unique entity identifier.

    entity_type
    required
    string

    Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

    device_id
    string

    Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

    array<string>

    Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

    Items:
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    area
    string

    Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • object
    uid: driverMetadata

    Integration driver metadata.

    driver_id
    required
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    driver_url
    string
    format: uri<= 2048 characters

    Optional WebSocket URL of the driver to override mDNS information.

    auth_method
    string
    uid: intgAuthMethod

    Integration driver authentication method if a token is required.

    The JSON auth message is used if a token is configured but no authentication method is set.

      Allowed values:
    • "HEADER"
    • "MESSAGE"
    version
    required
    string
    <= 20 characters

    Driver version, SemVer preferred.

    min_core_api
    string
    <= 20 characters

    Optional version check: minimum required Core-API version in the remote.

    icon
    string
    <= 255 charactersuid: iconIdentifier

    Optional icon identifier. If specified the icon will be set. An empty identifier while updating the object removes the existing icon.

    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    object
    uid: driverDeveloper

    Optional information about the integration developer.

    name
    string
    <= 50 characters

    Optional developer information to display in UI / web-configurator.

    url
    string
    format: uri<= 255 characters

    Optional developer home page.

    email
    string
    format: email<= 100 characters

    Optional developer contact email.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    home_page
    string
    format: uri<= 255 characters

    Optional home page url for more information.

    device_discovery
    boolean

    Driver supports multi-device discovery. Not yet supported.

    object
    uid: DriverManifest

    The driver manifest contains required and optional features for the driver to work.

    Furthermore, it can also contain additional metadata for the Core service, which is required for certain features. For example OAuth2 configuration data like the authorization and token endpoints. This data may only be transmitted to the core, but won't be exposed in the driver management API endpoints.

    array<object>

    Required features of an integration driver.

    name
    required
    string
    <= 50 characters

    Feature name

    required
    boolean

    Optional or required feature

    Default value:true
    object

    Feature specific data

    Additional properties are allowed.

    iot_class
    string
    uid: IotClass

    How the integration connects and communicates with a device or service. Inspired by Home Assistant IoT class.

      Allowed values:
    • "assumed_state"
    • "cloud_polling"
    • "cloud_push"
    • "local_polling"
    • "local_push"

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    uid: SettingsPage

    Settings definition page, e.g. to configure an integration driver.

    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    required
    array<object>

    One or multiple input field definitions, with optional pre-set values.

    id
    required
    string
    <= 50

    Unique identifier of the setting to be returned with the entered value.

    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    required
    oneOf
    object
    uid: SettingTypeNumber

    Number input with optional min, max, steps and decimals properties. The default value must be specified in value. An optional unit of the number setting can be specified in units, which will be displayed next to the input field.

    required
    object
    value
    required
    number

    Default value for input field.

    min
    number

    Optional validation: minimum allowed value (inclusive).

    max
    number

    Optional validation: maximum allowed value (inclusive).

    steps
    number

    Optional validation: allowed step increment between values. Might also be used in the UI for input helpers.

    decimals
    integer
    >= 0

    Number of decimal places. 0 = integer value

    Default value:0
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Furthermore, it can also contain additional metadata for the Core service, which is required for certain features.     • "DISCONNECTED"

  • object
    uid: availableEntityFilter

    Optional filters

    device_id
    string

    Optional device instance filter if driver supports multi instances.

    string anyOf
    uid: entityType

    Supported entities, defined as extensible enum: already known entity types are in the enum, but other string values are allowed for forward compatability.

    Can adhere to:
    string
      Allowed values:
    • "button"
    • "switch"
    • "light"
    • "cover"
    • "media_player"
    • "climate"
    • "sensor"
    • "remote"
    • "ir_emitter"
    Or to:
    any

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • object
    uid: entity

    Common definition of an entity. Concrete entities are: cover, button, climate, ir_emitter, light, media_player, remote,sensor, switch.

    See entity documentation for more information.

    The entity_type value acts as discriminator for the entity type, which defines the supported features and options of an entity.
    E.g. a simple button entity supports on / off, whereas a cover entity can be a simple window cover with only the ability to open / close, or a venetian blind with position and tilting features.
    See polymorphism support in AsyncAPI specification for more information.

    entity_id
    required
    string

    Unique entity identifier.

    entity_type
    required
    string

    Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

    device_id
    string

    Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

    array<string>

    Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

    Items:
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    area
    string

    Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • allOf
    uid: button

    A button entity can fire an event or start an action which cannot be further controlled once started.

    This can be used for "fire and forget" commands, e.g. running a system command, sending an IR code, restart a device, reset something etc.

    A button is stateless. To represent something that can be turned on and off, then the switch entity should be used.

    See button entity documentation for more information.

    object
    uid: entity

    Common definition of an entity. Concrete entities are: cover, button, climate, ir_emitter, light, media_player, remote,sensor, switch.

    See entity documentation for more information.

    The entity_type value acts as discriminator for the entity type, which defines the supported features and options of an entity.
    E.g. a simple button entity supports on / off, whereas a cover entity can be a simple window cover with only the ability to open / close, or a venetian blind with position and tilting features.
    See polymorphism support in AsyncAPI specification for more information.

    entity_id
    required
    string

    Unique entity identifier.

    entity_type
    required
    string

    Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

    device_id
    string

    Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

    array<string>

    Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

    Items:
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    area
    string

    Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    array<string>
    Items:
    string
      Allowed values:
    • "press"

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • allOf
    uid: switch

    A switch entity can turn something on or off and the current state should be readable by the integration driver.

    If the state can't be read, the readable option property can be set to false. This should be avoided whenever possible, because the UC Remote either has to assume the current state, or the UI needs to ask the user for the current state.

    If the switch controls a light source, then the 'light' entity is usually a better choice.

    See switch entity documentation for more information.

    object
    uid: entity

    Common definition of an entity. Concrete entities are: cover, button, climate, ir_emitter, light, media_player, remote,sensor, switch.

    See entity documentation for more information.

    The entity_type value acts as discriminator for the entity type, which defines the supported features and options of an entity.
    E.g. a simple button entity supports on / off, whereas a cover entity can be a simple window cover with only the ability to open / close, or a venetian blind with position and tilting features.
    See polymorphism support in AsyncAPI specification for more information.

    entity_id
    required
    string

    Unique entity identifier.

    entity_type
    required
    string

    Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

    device_id
    string

    Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

    array<string>

    Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

    Items:
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    area
    string

    Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    device_class
    string

    Optional device type. This can be used by the UI to represent the entity with a different icon, behaviour etc.

      Allowed values:
    • "switch"
    • "outlet"
    array<string>
    Items:
    string
      Allowed values:
    • "on_off"
    • "toggle"
    object
    readable
    boolean

    If set to false the current state of the switch cannot be read. This will make the switch stateless and the UI might ask the user for the current state.

    Default value:true

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • allOf
    uid: climate

    A climate entity controls heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) devices. This can range from simple fans to personal air conditioning units to integrated building devices.

    See climate entity documentation for more information.

    object
    uid: entity

    Common definition of an entity. Concrete entities are: cover, button, climate, ir_emitter, light, media_player, remote,sensor, switch.

    See entity documentation for more information.

    The entity_type value acts as discriminator for the entity type, which defines the supported features and options of an entity.
    E.g. a simple button entity supports on / off, whereas a cover entity can be a simple window cover with only the ability to open / close, or a venetian blind with position and tilting features.
    See polymorphism support in AsyncAPI specification for more information.

    entity_id
    required
    string

    Unique entity identifier.

    entity_type
    required
    string

    Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

    device_id
    string

    Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

    array<string>

    Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

    Items:
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    area
    string

    Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    array<string>

    Climate features:

    • on_off: The device can be turned on and off. The active HVAC mode after power on is device specific and must be reflected in the state attribute.
    • heat: The device supports heating.
    • cool: The device supports cooling.
    • current_temperature: The device can measure the current temperature
    • target_temperature: The device supports a target temperature for heating or cooling.
    • target_temperature_range: The device supports a target temperature range.
    • fan: The device has a controllable fan.
    Items:
    string
      Allowed values:
    • "on_off"
    • "heat"
    • "cool"
    • "current_temperature"
    • "target_temperature"
    • "target_temperature_range"
    • "fan"
    object
    temperature_unit
    string
    Default value:"CELSIUS"
      Allowed values:
    • "CELSIUS"
    • "FAHRENHEIT"
    target_temperature_step
    number
    >= 0.1

    Step value for the UI for setting the target temperature. Defaults: CELSIUS = 0.5, FAHRENHEIT = 1. Smallest step size: 0.1

    Default value:0.5
    max_temperature
    integer
    format: int32

    Maximum temperature to show in the UI for the target temperature range. Defaults: CELSIUS = 30, FAHRENHEIT = 90.

    Default value:30
    min_temperature
    integer
    format: int32

    Minimum temperature to show in the UI for the target temperature range. Defaults: CELSIUS = 10, FAHRENHEIT = 50.

    Default value:10

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • allOf
    uid: cover

    Entity for covering or opening things like blinds, window covers, curtains, etc. The entity features specify the abilities of the cover and the controllable properties, whereas the device_class specifies the UI representation.

    See cover entity documentation for more information.

    object
    uid: entity

    Common definition of an entity. Concrete entities are: cover, button, climate, ir_emitter, light, media_player, remote,sensor, switch.

    See entity documentation for more information.

    The entity_type value acts as discriminator for the entity type, which defines the supported features and options of an entity.
    E.g. a simple button entity supports on / off, whereas a cover entity can be a simple window cover with only the ability to open / close, or a venetian blind with position and tilting features.
    See polymorphism support in AsyncAPI specification for more information.

    entity_id
    required
    string

    Unique entity identifier.

    entity_type
    required
    string

    Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

    device_id
    string

    Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

    array<string>

    Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

    Items:
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    area
    string

    Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    device_class
    string

    Optional cover classification. If not specified, the entity will be treated as a window blind.
    The device class is used by the UI to represent the cover with a different icon, behaviour etc.

      Allowed values:
    • "blind"
    • "curtain"
    • "garage"
    • "shade"
    • "door"
    • "gate"
    • "window"
    array<string>

    Cover features:

    • open: The cover can can be opened.
    • close: The cover can can be closed.
    • stop: Opening, closing or setting the position can be stopped.
    • position: The cover can be moved to a specific position, e.g. 30% open.
    • tilt: The cover supports being tilted up and down.
    • tilt_stop: Tilting the cover can be stopped.
    • tilt_position: The cover can be moved to a specific tilt position.
    Items:
    string
      Allowed values:
    • "open"
    • "close"
    • "stop"
    • "position"
    • "tilt"
    • "tilt_stop"
    • "tilt_position"

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • allOf
    uid: ir_emitter

    An IR-emitter entity allows to send IR commands in PRONTO hex format.

    This entity allows to integrate external IR blasters and emitters. Once added to a Remote, a new IR-emitter output is registered which can be used for IR-remote entities. Similar as adding a new dock.

    See IR-emitter entity documentation for more information.

    object
    uid: entity

    Common definition of an entity. Concrete entities are: cover, button, climate, ir_emitter, light, media_player, remote,sensor, switch.

    See entity documentation for more information.

    The entity_type value acts as discriminator for the entity type, which defines the supported features and options of an entity.
    E.g. a simple button entity supports on / off, whereas a cover entity can be a simple window cover with only the ability to open / close, or a venetian blind with position and tilting features.
    See polymorphism support in AsyncAPI specification for more information.

    entity_id
    required
    string

    Unique entity identifier.

    entity_type
    required
    string

    Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

    device_id
    string

    Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

    array<string>

    Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

    Items:
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    area
    string

    Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    array<string>
    Items:
    string
      Allowed values:
    • "send_ir"
    object
    array<object>

    List of individual emitter ports which can be selected for sending IR commands.

    id
    string
    [ 1 .. 32 ] characters
    name
    string
    [ 1 .. 50 ] characters
    array<string>

    Supported IR formats besides PRONTO. The PRONTO hex format must always be supported.

    Items:
    string
    uid: IrFormat

    Supported IR formats by the emitter

      Allowed values:
    • "PRONTO"
    • "HEX"

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • allOf
    uid: light

    A light entity can be switched on and off and depending on its features, the light source can be further controlled like setting brightness, hue, color saturation and color temperature.

    The HSV color model is used for adjusting color and brightness.

    See light entity documentation for more information.

    object
    uid: entity

    Common definition of an entity. Concrete entities are: cover, button, climate, ir_emitter, light, media_player, remote,sensor, switch.

    See entity documentation for more information.

    The entity_type value acts as discriminator for the entity type, which defines the supported features and options of an entity.
    E.g. a simple button entity supports on / off, whereas a cover entity can be a simple window cover with only the ability to open / close, or a venetian blind with position and tilting features.
    See polymorphism support in AsyncAPI specification for more information.

    entity_id
    required
    string

    Unique entity identifier.

    entity_type
    required
    string

    Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

    device_id
    string

    Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

    array<string>

    Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

    Items:
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    area
    string

    Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    array<string>
    Items:
    string
      Allowed values:
    • "on_off"
    • "toggle"
    • "dim"
    • "color"
    • "color_temperature"
    object
    color_temperature_steps
    integer
    [ 2 .. 100 ]

    Number of color temperature steps of the light source. Some lamps only support 3 modes, where others can be adjusted freely.

    Default value:100

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • allOf
    uid: media_player

    A media player entity controls playback of media on a device. This could be an online music streaming service, a TV, a stereo or a video player.

    See media player entity documentation for more information.

    object
    uid: entity

    Common definition of an entity. Concrete entities are: cover, button, climate, ir_emitter, light, media_player, remote,sensor, switch.

    See entity documentation for more information.

    The entity_type value acts as discriminator for the entity type, which defines the supported features and options of an entity.
    E.g. a simple button entity supports on / off, whereas a cover entity can be a simple window cover with only the ability to open / close, or a venetian blind with position and tilting features.
    See polymorphism support in AsyncAPI specification for more information.

    entity_id
    required
    string

    Unique entity identifier.

    entity_type
    required
    string

    Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

    device_id
    string

    Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

    array<string>

    Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

    Items:
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    area
    string

    Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    array<string>
    Items:
    string
      Allowed values:
    • "on_off"
    • "toggle"
    • "volume"
    • "volume_up_down"
    • "mute_toggle"
    • "mute"
    • "unmute"
    • "play_pause"
    • "stop"
    • "next"
    • "previous"
    • "fast_forward"
    • "rewind"
    • "repeat"
    • "shuffle"
    • "seek"
    • "media_duration"
    • "media_position"
    • "media_title"
    • "media_artist"
    • "media_album"
    • "media_image_url"
    • "media_type"
    • "dpad"
    • "numpad"
    • "home"
    • "menu"
    • "context_menu"
    • "guide"
    • "info"
    • "color_buttons"
    • "channel_switcher"
    • "select_source"
    • "select_sound_mode"
    • "eject"
    • "open_close"
    • "audio_track"
    • "subtitle"
    • "record"
    • "settings"
    object
    array<string>

    Additional commands the media-player supports, which are not covered in the feature list.
    Example: ["EXIT", "THUMBS_UP", "THUMBS_DOWN"]

    Items:
    string
    format: ^[A-Z0-9/_.:+#*@%()?-]{1,20}$uid: SimpleCommand
    volume_steps
    integer
    [ 2 .. 100 ]

    Number of available volume steps for the set volume command and UI controls. Examples:

    • 100 = any value between 0..100
    • 50 = only odd numbers
    • 3 = [33, 67, 100]
    • etc.

    Value 0 = mute.

    Note: if the integration receives an "unexpected" number it is required to round up or down to the next matching value.

    Default value:100

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • allOf
    uid: remote

    A remote entity can send commands to a controllable device.

    See remote entity documentation for more information.

    object
    uid: entity

    Common definition of an entity. Concrete entities are: cover, button, climate, ir_emitter, light, media_player, remote,sensor, switch.

    See entity documentation for more information.

    The entity_type value acts as discriminator for the entity type, which defines the supported features and options of an entity.
    E.g. a simple button entity supports on / off, whereas a cover entity can be a simple window cover with only the ability to open / close, or a venetian blind with position and tilting features.

    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    array<string>
    Items:
    string
      Allowed values:
    • "send_cmd"
    • "on_off"
    • "toggle"
    object
    array<string>

    Optional list of supported commands. If not provided, the integration driver has to document the available commands for the user.
    Example: ["EXIT", "CHANNEL_UP", "CHANNEL_DOWN"]

    Items:
    string
    format: ^\S{1,20}$uid: SimpleRemoteCommand
    array<object>
    button
    required
    string

    Physical button identifier

    object
    uid: EntityCommand
    cmd_id
    required
    string

    Simple command name or entity command identifier, as returned in the entity command metadata.

    object

    For entity commands: optional command parameters as key / value pairs. See entity documentation for available parameters.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    uid: EntityCommand
    cmd_id
    required

    Simple command name or entity command identifier, as returned in the entity command metadata.

    object

    For entity commands: optional command parameters as key / value pairs. See entity documentation for available parameters.

    object
    uid: UserInterface
    array<object>
    page_id
    required
    string
    name
    string

    Optional page name

    required
    object
    uid: Grid

    Grid layout size.

    width
    required
    integer
    >= 1
    height
    required
    integer
    >= 1

    Additional properties are allowed.

    required
    array<object>
    type
    required
    string

    Type of the user interface item:

    • icon: show an icon, either a UC icon or a custom icon. Field icon must contain the icon identifier.
    • text: show text only from field text.
      Allowed values:
    • "icon"
    • "text"
    • "numpad"
    icon
    string

    Optional icon identifier. The identifier consists of a prefix and a resource identifier, separated by :. Available prefixes:

    • uc: - integrated icon font
    • custom: - custom resource
    text
    string
    object
    uid: EntityCommand
    cmd_id
    required
    string

    Simple command name or entity command identifier, as returned in the entity command metadata.

    object

    For entity commands: optional command parameters as key / value pairs. See entity documentation for available parameters.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    required
    object
    uid: GridLocation

    Button placement in the grid with 0-based coordinates.

    x
    required
    integer
    >= 0
    y
    required
    integer
    >= 0

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    uid: GridItemSize

    Item size in the button grid. Default size if not specified: 1 x 1

    width
    integer
    >= 1
    Default value:1
    height
    integer
    >= 1
    Default value:1

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • allOf
    uid: sensor

    A sensor entity provides measured values from devices or dedicated hardware sensors.
    The device class specifies the type of sensor and links it with a default unit of measurement to display in the user interface.

    • The custom device class allows arbitrary UI labels and units.
    • The temperature device class performs automatic conversion between C and F.

    See sensor entity documentation for more information.

    object
    uid: entity

    Common definition of an entity. Concrete entities are: cover, button, climate, ir_emitter, light, media_player, remote,sensor, switch.

    See entity documentation for more information.

    The entity_type value acts as discriminator for the entity type, which defines the supported features and options of an entity.
    E.g. a simple button entity supports on / off, whereas a cover entity can be a simple window cover with only the ability to open / close, or a venetian blind with position and tilting features.
    See polymorphism support in AsyncAPI specification for more information.

    entity_id
    required
    string

    Unique entity identifier.

    entity_type
    required
    string

    Discriminator value for the concrete entity device type.

    device_id
    string

    Optional associated device, if the integration driver supports multiple devices.

    array<string>

    Supported features of the entity. See concrete entity definition for available features.

    Items:
    string
    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    area
    string

    Optional area if supported by the integration, e.g. Living room. This information might be used by the UI in the setup process to automatically create profile pages for all areas returned in the available entities.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    object
    device_class
    string

    Sensor type. This is used by the UI to represent the sensor with a matching icon, default unit etc.
    To use a custom unit

      Allowed values:
    • "custom"
    • "temperature"
    • "humidity"
    • "power"
    • "energy"
    • "voltage"
    • "current"
    • "battery"
    object
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    native_unit
    any

    The sensor's native unit of measurement to perform automatic conversion. Applicable to device classes: temperature

    decimals
    integer

    Number of decimal places to show in the UI if the sensor provides the measurement as a number. Not applicable to string values.

    Default value:0
    min_value
    number

    Optional minimum value of the sensor output. This can be used in the UI for graphs or gauges.

    max_value
    number

    Optional maximum value of the sensor output. This can be used in the UI for graphs or gauges.

    Additional properties are allowed.

    Additional properties are allowed.

  • string anyOf
    uid: entityType

    Supported entities, defined as extensible enum: already known entity types are in the enum, but other string values are allowed for forward compatability.

    Can adhere to:
    string
      Allowed values:
    • "button"
    • "switch"
    • "light"
    • "cover"
    • "media_player"
    • "climate"
    • "sensor"
    • "remote"
    • "ir_emitter"
    Or to:
    any
  • SimpleCommand
    string
    format: ^[A-Z0-9/_.:+#*@%()?-]{1,20}$uid: SimpleCommand
  • SimpleRemoteCommand
    string
    format: ^\S{1,20}$uid: SimpleRemoteCommand
  • object
    uid: driverSetupChange
    event_type
    required
    string
    • START: setup started
    • SETUP: setup in progress. See state enum for current setup state.
    • STOP: setup finished, either with: state: OK for successful setup, or state: ERROR if setup didn't completed successfully.
      Allowed values:
    • "START"
    • "SETUP"
    • "STOP"
    state
    required
    string
    uid: integrationSetupState
    • SETUP: setup in progress
    • WAIT_USER_ACTION: setup flow is waiting for user input. See require_user_action for requested input.
    • OK: setup finished successfully
    • ERROR: setup error
      Allowed values:
    • "SETUP"
    • "WAIT_USER_ACTION"
    • "OK"
    • "ERROR"
    error
    string
    uid: integrationSetupError

    More detailed error reason for state: ERROR condition.

      Allowed values:
    • "NONE"
    • "NOT_FOUND"
    • "CONNECTION_REFUSED"
    • "AUTHORIZATION_ERROR"
    • "TIMEOUT"
    • "OTHER"
    object oneOf

    If set, the setup process waits for the specified user action.

    object
    required
    object
    uid: SettingsPage

    Settings definition page, e.g. to configure an integration driver.

    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
    string

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    required
    array<object>

    One or multiple input field definitions, with optional pre-set values.

    id
    required
    string
    <= 50

    Unique identifier of the setting to be returned with the entered value.

    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)

    Key value pairs of language texts. Key: ISO 639-1 code with optional country suffix to represent a culture code. Examples: en, en_UK, en_US, de, de_CH.
    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

    Additional properties are NOT allowed.

    required
    oneOf
    object
    uid: SettingTypeNumber

    Number input with optional min, max, steps and decimals properties. The default value must be specified in value. An optional unit of the number setting can be specified in units, which will be displayed next to the input field.

    required
    object
    value
    required
    number

    Default value for input field.

    min
    number

    Optional validation: minimum allowed value (inclusive).

    max
    number

    Optional validation: maximum allowed value (inclusive).

    steps
    number

    Optional validation: allowed step increment between values. Might also be used in the UI for input helpers.

    decimals
    integer
    >= 0

    Number of decimal places. 0 = integer value

    Default value:0
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$

    If we need to support more regional differences within a country, then the IETF language tag might be a solution. This would even support the various Swiss German dialects!

  • object
    uid: Setting

    An input setting is of a specific type defined in field.type which defines how it is presented to the user.

    Inspired by the Homey SDK settings concept.

    id
    required
    string
    <= 50

    Unique identifier of the setting to be returned with the entered value.

    required
    object
    uid: languageText
    ^[a-z]{2}(_\w+)?$
    (pattern property)
